After a wealthy dowager who has made a substantial donation to her alma mater suddenly disappears, Nancy Drew sets out to solve the mystery.
Foxes are disappearing from fox farms.
Railroaded into prison through the efforts of politically ambitious assistant DA Marlin, Fred awaits his doom on Death Row, while Joyce works overtime on the outside to clear her husband's name
Sheila Regan (Lana Turner) is an elevator operator in love with her boyfriend Gil (Jimmy Stewart) when she's noticed by Ziegfeld's assistant.
Alan tries to keep his wife from meeting an old flame of his.
Rivals Bill Arden and Paul Herbert enter the U.S. Naval Academy at Annapolis in order to impress a girl.
A mad scientist changes his simple-minded handyman into a werewolf in order to prove his supposedly crazy scientific theories - and exact revenge.
A hat-check girl at the Stork Club (Hutton) saves the life of a drowning man (Fitzgerald).
Soon after a veteran returns from war, his cheating wife is found dead. He evades police in an attempt to find the real murderer.
A compulsive liar admits to a killing she didn't commit so her husband, a lawyer, can clear her and build a reputation for himself.
Dance of the Cookoos is merged a cinematic cross section with the high points from almost 100 works of Laurel & Hardy, into an original framework action

Pola is a beautiful but poor girl, a locksmith's daughter. Unexpectedly, she's successful as a stage dancer. After her success, she breaks with her fiancé and becomes the lover of a rich admirer. However, the fiancé does not accept her departure.
A silent film directed by Jan Pawlowski.
'The Yellow Pass' An early version of Der Gelbe Schein (The Yellow Ticket).
A lost film starring Pola Negri
A wild young girl runs away from her parents' house to support herself and attracts the attentions of a married man, who is prepared to abandon his wife and child for her.
Part of a 3 part series (Mysteries of Warsaw).
A silent film directed by Aleksander Hertz.
A german film released in 1917 starring Pola Negri.
German silent film starring Pola Negri.
Part of a 3 part series (Mysteries of Warsaw).
German silent film starring Pola Negri.
A silent film directed by Aleksander Hertz.
German film from 1917 starring Pola Negri
Movie_Name: Wenn das Herz in Haß erglüht

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Pola Negri plays a dual supporting role as a nun and a cabaret dancer in this film.
Movie_Name: Nicht Lange Täuschte Mich das Glück

Brief_Description_of_Movie: German film from 1918 starring Pola Negri
Egyptians Radu and Ma milk British tourists out of their money by offering phony tours of a mummy's tomb-- Radu has the girl lend her eyes to the "mummy" from inside an empty sarcophagus.
A beautiful cigarette factory worker becomes the face of the company's new marketing campaign.

Anna Mirrel, a young Jewish girl in Czarist Russia, is forced to degrade herself in order to visit her father, whom she believes to be ill. She obtains a yellow passport, signifying that she is a prostitute.
The tragic story of Don Jose, a Spanish cavalryman, who falls under the spell of a gypsy girl, Carmen, who treats him with both love and contempt and leads him into temptation and thus damnation.
The Woman at the Crossroads (German: Kreuzigt sie!) is a 1919 German silent film directed by Georg Jacoby and starring Pola Negri, Harry Liedtke and Albert Patry.
A 1919 film starring Pola Negri.
A beautiful woman of the Latin Quarter, marries a rich cattle owner Pedro Maurez from South America to live in peace and happiness.
In Corsica, Marianna Paoli's brother is killed by an Englishman whose identity is unknown to her. She swears vengeance and tracks the killer to Monte Carlo.
The story of Madame du Barry, the mistress of Louis XV of France, and her loves in the time of the French revolution.
Countess Doddy (German: Komtesse Doddy) is a 1919 German silent comedy film directed by Georg Jacoby and starring Pola Negri, Harry Liedtke and Victor Janson.
A police chief raids a gambling den, and arrests the elderly mother of the young Assunta. Though she pleads with him, he will not release her mother. Years later, Assunta plots her revenge.
The favorite slave girl of a tyrannical sheik falls in love with a cloth merchant, which puts her life in terrible danger.
Intrigue or The Martyrium is a 1920 German silent drama film directed by Paul L. Stein and starring Pola Negri and Eduard von Winterstein.
The Closed Chain (German: Die geschlossene Kette) is a 1920 German silent film directed by Paul L. Stein and starring Pola Negri, Aud Egede-Nissen, and Carl Ebert.
A modern adaptation of Dumas' Camille.
A charismatic lieutenant newly assigned to a remote fort is captured by a group of mountain bandits, thus setting in motion a madcap farce that is Lubitsch at his most unrestrained.
Richard de la Croix's brother, Andreas, has been driven insane by a notorious vamp and socialite named Sappho.
In 19th century Paris a hedonistic woman marries an aristocrat but has trouble keeping faithful to him.
Bella Donna, a seductive woman snares Nigel Armine into marriage and he takes her to Egypt to live. Tired of her simple husband, Bella becomes involved with brutish Baroudi.
Her family, worried that Angela and Grandpa are getting into trouble, come to Hollywood to drag them back home.
After losing money she embezzled, a socialite borrows cash from a foreign "prince" who expects sexual favors in return.
The Spanish Dancer is the story of Maritana, a Romani girl who dances in courtyards and even tells people's fortunes. Despite her lowly position, Maritana wishes to be a Countess.
Forbidden Paradise is a 1924 American silent drama film produced by Famous Players-Lasky and distributed by Paramount Pictures. It was directed by German film director Ernst Lubitsch.
A young woman rises from an apache dancer to become a wealthy woman in post-WW1 Paris.
Cleo, a waitress in a Marseilles waterfront cafe, is lured to Paris by a baron who betrays her. Disillusioned, she resolves to use men as stepping stones to a life of luxury.

An innocent young librarian, Lily, catches the eye of several officers in a German garrison, and although one of the, Lieutenant Prell, is particularly attracted to her, she marries Colonel Mertzbach, the aristocratic regimental commander.

After being educated in England, Daisy Forbes returns to China, the country of her birth, and discovers that her father has recently died and that she has become a social outcast, owing to the public revelation that the oriental nurse who raised her was actually her mother.
Mariposa, a wild dancer in a cheap Seville cafe, is taken to New York by Señor Sprott, a prominent theatrical producer. Billed as "The Charmer," Mariposa becomes the toast of two continents.
Triumph of the daughter of a cheated mine owner over a renegade and her love for the superintendent.
A sensual European countess arrives at a small American town where she quickly provokes moral outrage from the community.
Olga Kriga, a boardinghouse girl who dreams of becoming a great actress, is turned down by a theater manager because of the jealousy of the leading lady.

Germaine Morris, considered an ugly duckling, is in love with her employer, Gerald Gray, an interior decorator who caters to the smart set, and is concerned over his affair with Claire Fenton, the wife of a wealthy broker.

During World War I, an Austrian officer is trapped behind the Russian lines. He tries to sneak through to his own lines, but is forced to take refuge in a small hotel, where he is hidden by the establishment's chambermaid.
In 1914 France, pastoral life on the Moreau farm is interrupted by war. Son Andre joins the army, a P.O.W. camp is built on the farm, and daughter Mona feels only hatred toward Germany.

Julie Morland, on trial for the murder of Gaston Napier, recalls the events of her life 6 years earlier: She is in love with Pierre Bouton, an artist stricken with a serious illness, and during a party at Gaston's studio she prevents his suicide.
An Elderly fruit grower sends a photo of his foreman, not himself, to a waitress he wishes to marry. She falls in love with the foreman.
A woman allows her husband, who she knows no longer loves her, to believe that she has been killed in a train wreck. Her husband later finds her as a hostess in a gambling den.

Rachel becomes the leading actress in the Comédie Française through the patronage of three influential men: Baron Hartman, the wealthiest man in France; Count Vareski, a relative of Napoleon; and Dr. Durande.
A princess falls in love with the man who killed her cousin. The lover swears it was in self-defense.
A lighthouse keeper's wife shelters her fugitive lover.

Pola Negri, Bebe Daniels, Mitzi Green, Polly Moran, Mack Sennett and Marjorie Beebe are seen relaxing at Palm Springs, a California winter resort; Barbara Stanwyck and Ricardo Cortez play golf; other celebrities are shown at Malibu Beach.
In order to keep his lover, Maria Draga, in luxury, Captain Alex Pastitsch of Serbia contracts huge debts, which threaten his military career.
After many difficulties, the seductive Italian dancer, Rosine Savelli, manages to clear herself of a plot hatched against Napoleon III.
A woman is put on trial for murdering a musician who ruined her marriage.

Spanning the years between the Bolshevik Revolution and 1930, this Negri vehicle focuses on an exiled Russian noblewoman who has lost track of her daughter and of a young officer she pined for.Until she finds them both again and together.
A drama film directed by Gerhard Lamprecht.
A famed composer has to prove his innocence, when his wife who has mysteriously disappeared is shot one day on the street.

The stand-alone opera singer Carmen Casini dare not admit to her adult son, the spoiled race car driver Cecil, that she ruined her voice on a stormy day at the racetrack and that her career is thus at an end.

Consul Brückmann is married for the second time to the much younger Peruvian Tessa, who one day meets her former childhood sweetheart Fernando. She plans to return to her homeland with him, but then a tragic catastrophe changes everything.

When the bride's mother is supposedly swindled out of her money by a spurned suitor, the groom's father orchestrates a scheme of his own to set things right. He is aided by a cabaret singer, while placating a jealous wife.
British musicologist Frances Ferris (Joan Greenwood) and her late teen niece Nikky Ferris (Hayley Mills) are travelling through Crete recording Greek folk songs for the BBC.
Dorothy Madison, a secret service operative, is sent into the West Virginia mountains to locate a still, after male operatives failed.
At his palace the Gypsy girl learns for the first time that her lover is already married and is the father of baby Mignon.
Parker, an Army lieutenant at a Western outpost, falls in love with Barbara Taylor, daughter of his commanding officer. But when Barbara rejects him, Parker fights with another soldier and deserts.

A janitor finds a piece of jewelry dropped by a young woman, which he in turn gives to his wife. Feeling sorry for the young woman, the janitor tries to straighten things out, with many funny complications.

Hubby can't stand his wife's cooking and he goes to the employment agency and gets Sweedy as a new cook. They arrive home and dinner is about to be served. Sweedy never reaches the table, however, for her foot slips and the expected dinner flies away.

Madge Garvey (Dorothy Phillips) works in a shoe factory. Her father Joe (Richard de la Reno) is a drunk who beats his wife (Alice May Youss), and her sister Helen (Belle Bennett) has repeated the pattern by marrying Dan Mallory (Edward Brady).

Genuinely sweet natured, Ambrosia Lee loves to help everyone, soothing their sorrows with her cheerful spirit. Her charms are put to the test, when she tries to save her own Aunt Charlotte's marriage.

When stern Judge McClure gets into an argument with his younger brother John, a physical fight ensues in which the judge apparently kills John. In fear of the consequences, he runs off to the West and hires guide Cal Nelson to take him far into the desert.
To the lawless town of Snowstorm, Arizona comes the sickly Reverend Roger Ingraham, who is determined to spread the word of God.
Jim Gordon, a stranger to Paluski, a Western mining settlement, does not drink or gamble, and refuses dance hall girls' advances.

Jennie is a slavey in a theatrical boarding house. To her the actors are all wonderful, but Montague Booth is the chief. In an accident Booth is disfigured for life and is saved from suicide by Jennie.

During World War I, Jane Whiting, a bright young lawyer who is engaged to Senator Wheeler, is assigned by the district attorney to expose a gang of spies who are collecting money for the German government through the operation of a fraudulent charity organization.
A Jewish mother in New York finds herself at odds with her son's new wife, a pretty Gentile girl.
She is killed through the mistake of one of Wallace's enemies, who had planned to murder the scientist in an insane rage at the way Wallace treats the girl.
A sequel of sorts, the Jewish ethnic comedy characters of Potash and Perlmutter return from their 1923 debut film, also produced by Goldwyn, but with a different actor for Potash.
Movie_Name: In Hollywood with Potash and Perlmutter

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A comedy short directed by character Slim Summerville.
John Douglas, a down-on-his-luck engineer, takes his sweetheart, Sara Deeping, to a play starring Carla King, and he falls in love with the actress.
When Matt and Amy Dale separate, their son, Matthew, is put in an English school and kept in ignorance of his parents' identities.
Upon the suicide of his father, socialite Stephen Dallas leaves his opulent home and goes to live in a small town where he marries Stella, a woman far below his social station.
This most famous of Victorian melodramas was more than half a century old, and had already been filmed several times when it came to the screen once again in 1925.
Belle Bennett, the unforgettable star of the original Stella Dallas (1926), again suffers nobly through the "mother love" melodrama Reckless Lady.
The unreasonable attitude of the count gradually causes Odette's latent rebellious nature to rise to the surface.
Following a reversal in the Graham family fortune, a childhood love affair between Gordon Graham and Marjorie Miller is frustrated by the socially ambitious Mrs. Miller.
With Vera Baranovskaya, Nicolai Batalov, A.P. Chistiakov. With music track. Russian intertitles with English subtitles.
The story takes place in Milwaukee during the early 1900s with a bank clerk named August Schiller who is happy with both his job and his family.
Silent romantic melodrama about a wife and mother who is desperate to keep a secret from the past IN the past, despite her husband's intentions.
Ellen McHugh, a poor Irish immigrant to America, finds work in a carnival and is thus able to send her son Brian to a fine school. But when her position is found out, the school expels Brian.

The Devil's Skipper was based on Demetrios Contos, a seafaring yarn by Jack London. Effectively cast against type, Belle Bennett plays a wronged woman who becomes the most brutal and feared slave-ship captain on the Seven Seas.

Blinded in a train accident James Driscoll (Holmes Herbert), whose wife, Miriam Driscoll (Belle Bennett), has been having an affair with his young male secretary Phillip Kingston )Carroll Nye), regains his eyesight.
After the wealthy and married William Judson (Jean Hersholt) meets young, attractive Marie (Phyllis Haver), he is flattered by her attention.
Overcome by love and gratitude for Mamie's sacrificial silence, Gloria vows that together they will do everything to make Donald's life a happy one.
King Louis XIII of France is thrilled to have born to him a son - an heir to the throne.
Vaudeville headliners Molly and Jim Wilson have been waiting for 10 years for their chance on Broadway, but when it comes, it comes for Jim alone, headlining the Frolics at $1,000 a week.
Mamie Reynolds has been engaged to Sam Young for ten years. But when Sam's novel is published after many years of waiting, Sam falls for a gold digger.
Lally is a rich girl whose father writes books and plays polo. After 23 years of marriage her father decides to divorce Lally's mother and remarry to soon-to-be-divorced Beth Cheever.
Muriel, engaged to marry Lynn Willard, a well-to-do youth, is shocked at her mother's actions and plans to sacrifice herself to Rudlin to clear their obligation.
In this drama, a 50-year-old married man (played by John Halliday) goes with his wife (Belle Bennett) and son (Junior Durkin) to a nightclub in a fancy hotel in Detroit.
A young man runs into trouble when he buys an auto court, only to find out that its located next to a swamp that drives away all potential customers.

A young British girl born and raised in India loses her neglectful parents in an earthquake. She is returned to England to live at her uncle's estate. Her uncle is very distant due to the loss of his wife ten years before.
Young Jack Wright offers his hand in marriage to the winner of a lottery, but after committing to the winner falls in love with another woman.
When an aristocratic family and their servants are shipwrecked, the butler becomes their ruler.

Mildly entertaining silent film about Anthony Hamilton Hawthorne, American (played by Wallace Reid), who breaks the bank at Monte Carlo, then travels through the kingdom of Bovinia, along with his best pal/sidekick Harry Blake …
Harry Harper has invented a submarine. He reads about a shipwreck that contains treasure and decides to find it, with the idea of sharing the wealth with his community.
Maggie, the mistress of dissipated politician Peter Moran, attempts to force Moran to marry her by passing off the infant Ed Simpson as his child.
When Mrs. Rolles (Farrington) insists that she will not have Austin Bevans (Reid) as a son-in-law, he insists that she will.
Because Bob Meredith (Jack Holt) spends all his time working, his wife Margaret (Lois Wilson) feels the romance has ebbed away from their marriage.
Hijinks surrounding the attendance of a Prince at a Yacht Club dinner.
Based on the comic strip character and his auto obsessed life.
A doctor who believes he can cure criminals takes on a big challenge.
After the Show was adapted from Rita Weiman's story "The Stage Door." Lila Lee plays Eileen, a starry-eyed young girl employed as a chorus dancer in New York.
A penniless artist moves into an abandoned house, but is discovered by the daughter of its former owner.
Ek is a disembodied spirit, required to wait his turn in the boring cosmos until he is allowed to inhabit an earthly body.
The WAMPAS Baby Stars of 1922: With Marion Aye, Helen Ferguson, Lila Lee, Jacqueline Logan.
Unreleased in America, this was one of Arbuckle's last starring roles in a feature film.
A silent romantic adventure melodrama (from the play and novel by Richard Harding) about a womanizer who follows a beautiful Hispanic woman to her home country and his adventures …
Documentary short film depicting the filmmaking activity at the Paramount Studios in Hollywood, featuring dozens of stars captured candidly and at work.
Juan (Rudolph Valentino) is the son of a poor widow in Seville. Against his mother's wishes he pursues a career as toreador.
A young man and his manservant, escaping from a backwoods family feud, are persuaded by a beautiful young heiress to help her rid her newly-gained Spanish castle of ghosts.
An old skipper, Captain Davis, has as his companions two derelicts -- one, Huish, is a Cockney, and the other, Robert Herrick was once a gentleman.
Stephen Cortlandt's death is blamed on Kirk until Edith produces a suicide note; he succeeds in his railroad position and returns to the United States with Chiquita to ask his father's forgiveness.
A group of seven people find themselves on a ship in the middle of an endless ocean, with no recollection of how they got there.
As a smart satire with sparkling wit Hollywood, James Cruze's latest production, overwhelms all other screen efforts in its line.
At sight of a woman, he got a ticket for speeding.
Toughened criminal Jim Reagan tries to persuade his brother, Larry, to go straight, but Larry attempts to rob a banker, Richard Milton, and is arrested.
Diana Moreland, aware of her husband's attentions to Marilyn Foster, surprises the pair dining at a roadhouse and invites Marilyn to her home.

A vengeful husband pursues and kidnaps his wife aboard a deserted ship when he becomes injured and taken aboard, then sinks in a collision following a fight with the captain for his wife. A thrilling tale of love and adventure on the high seas and in colorful Mexico!
Wealthy arts impresario Nicholas Harmon tires of his aging operatic star Nina, who is also his lover.
Because he wants a promotion, Tom Blackford marries Alice Rand, the daughter of his boss, John Rand.
A Jewish writer in Czarist Russia is forced to flee when the government comes after him for his "objectionable" writings. He emigrates to the US, where he settles in New York City's Lower East Side.

Tom Kelly, a small-town baseball pitcher, is sent to a minor-league team in Florida, and fails to make the team. He starts dabbling in real estate, in the midst of the Florida land boom (in which a lot of the land sold was under water), makes a fortune and buys into the team that cut him from its roster.
Playboy Teddy Ward wants to marry artist Jeannie King; his father wants him to marry Loris Lane, but tells him he can marry his choice if he can make the Mountain Inn a profitable operation.

Stars Edmund Lowe as WWI veteran Slim Paris. Though most of his comrades died in battle, Paris returns home with nary a scratch. This convinces him that his life has a "greater purpose" in the scheme of things, so he sets about to find that purpose.
A gangster falls in love with the daughter of a former colleague who has quit the rackets. However, things aren't exactly what they appear to be.
In France Mulligan and Neilan are sent spy hunting and are captured with a labor unit after putting on cork.

Vacationing in the Canadian Northwest, a playwright and a songwriter both fall in love with Marie Cleste and take her back with them to New York when her father and her sweetheart apparently die in a forest fire.
The daughter of a wealthy industrialist wants to take over the company when her father retires, but the father--an old-fashioned sort who doesn't believe that "girls" belong in business
After many outrageous moments, a young girl marries her former acquaintance, not with her fiancee.
Hollywood actresses including Jeanette Loff and Raquel Torres modeling Spring fashions in color.

A pearl stolen from an Indian idol results in nothing but trouble for its owner. After he receives death threats by note pinned to a dagger, he decides to gather his relatives in his old mansion for a reading of his will.
Irked by the success of a brassy nightclub owner. her rivals set out to drive her out of business, and frame her for a murder in the bargain.
Young David Carroll takes over the publication of a local Vermont newspaper.
Pat and Danny McGlone are identical twin brothers, rivals and competitors in everything they do, and Pat grows up and becomes a policeman while Danny turns to a life of crime.
A multimillionaire is murdered, and his will leaves all his money to a beautiful young blonde.
Nightclub hostess Sophie Leonard educates her daughter, Beth, abroad and keeps her life secret for her.

Two Marine pilots in love with the same girl are assigned a mission to find a notorious bandit in Nicaragua. This early talkie from director Frank Capra, released in 1929, stars Jack Holt, Ralph Graves and Lila Lee.
Any movie that starts Jewish entertainer George Jessel as an Italian accordionist named Luigi can't be all bad.

The studio that gave the cinema its voice offered 1929 audiences a chance to see and hear multiple silent-screen favorites for the first time in a gaudy, grandiose music-comedy-novelty revue that also included Talkie stars, Broadway luminaries and of course, Rin-Tin-Tin.
The Sacred Flame is a 1929 sound (All-Talking) film directed by Archie Mayo, starring Pauline Frederick and Conrad Nagel, and based on a 1928 Broadway play of the same title by Somerset Maugham.
After the death of his first wife, Walter Fairchild, engaged to Florence Wendell, is convinced that he must establish a new home in order that their married life be a success.
A policeman doubles as a gunman to get in with the mob.
Ex-convict David Harvey attempts to go straight and settles in a small town where he meets and falls in love with Mary Carlyle.
A trio of former sideshow performers double as the "Unholy Three" in a scam to nab some shiny rocks.
A series of murders that take place in an old, dark mansion are suspected of being committed by an ape.

Judith Temple has come West to Arizona for some excitement. As she says goodbye to her brother and his wife, who are returning to the East, Dr. Neil Cranford, who is in love with her, is called away to tend the broken ribs of a man injured in a barroom brawl.
Ellen, a young American girl who married a European prince and moved to his country, is preparing to return to the US, after having paid off all the debts left by her now-deceased husband.
A policeman in need of money is persuaded to take a $1000 bribe to stay away the night a packing house is to be robbed.
An adaptation of Madame Bovary transported to Rye, New York in the 1930's. All characters have been renamed.
In this war drama, a brave reporter tries to remain detached while covering the war in Shanghai.
A reporter runs into a pretty young girl who has inherited her father's failing business.
Elna Curry, once a concert pianist, develops an unfounded jealousy of neighbor, Trudie Morrow.

The philandering Dr. Silas Brenton is fired from his position at a large hospital and given 24 hours to vacate the state. He sets himself up in Chicago as a "prestigious" plastic surgeon to the stars.
A motorcycle policeman's partner is deliberately run off the road and killed by a member of a syndicate that controls the gambling--and much of the justice system--in his town.

Joe and Lucky travel around New England painting barns in exchange for an advertisement on one side. The meet Madge, who is cruelly treated by a her father who plans to marry her off to someone she despises.
The wealthy owner of an iron foundry dies, and his greedy heirs are outraged when they find out that he left his entire estate not to them but to the foreman of his foundry.
After a murder goes unsolved on a sinking ocean liner, the survivors assemble on a deserted island with the killer still lurking among them.
Young Scooter O’Neal, orphaned after his father’s suicide, is sent out West to live with family friend Dobe Jones.
A father and daughter reunite after years, and people mistake their filial relationship for a romantic one.
President Franklin Roosevelt appoints a theatrical producer as the new Secretary of Amusement in order to cheer up an American public still suffering through the Depression.
John, sympathetic to Sharon, promises to keep her informed of Laury's welfare and helps her find a job at the Kiddie Kabaret, where his friend Stevens is the ringmaster.
An ex-convict, unable to get a good job because of his prison record, gets mixed up in a phony stock scam.
Money was what gangster Vince M. Falcone wanted most and he did lay hands on millions of dollars by fair means or (mostly) foul.
A doctor is driven into an investigation of sinister goings-on at a horse race track by his mystery writer ex-wife.

After being run out of town after town for trying to sell worthless stock, two con artists breeze into the small town of Chesterville, where they find themselves accused of kidnapping a young boy to whom they offered a ride.
The two leading ladies are cast as Prudence and Agatha, a pair of old-fashioned schoolteachers in an old-fashioned small town.
Believing they can make a ton of money, a gang of opportunists uses the country's racial and ethnic tensions to start a Ku Klux Klan-type organization.

Lux Video Theatre is an American anthology series that was produced from 1950 until 1959. The series presented both comedy and drama in original teleplays, as well as abridged adaptations of films and plays.
After being released from a mental hospital a man tries to find out why his best friend wants him dead.
This is a decent enough introduction to the man and the legend for someone who is unfamiliar with Rudolph Valentino, but it contains little new detail for anyone else.
This is a straight version of the old fairy tale, with John Carradine as the Emperor. It was filmed in South Florida, with exteriors in Coral Gables and Miami's Vizcaya.
Darby Clyde Fenster and Jerry Martin are a pair of penniless nincompoop-drifters who hop a freight train on their way to Florida.
The story of a poor young woman, separated by prejudice from her husband and baby, is interwoven with tales of intolerance from throughout history.
Movie_Name: Intolerance: Love's Struggle Throughout the Ages

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Now the young man, minister in tow, pursues his bride while her father and a horde of lawmen pursue them both. A young couple attempts to elope, with the bride's irate father in hot pursuit.

"Waffles," the waitress at "Coffee Dan's" hash-house, is selected by Bert Gallagher and Clara Johnstone, a pair of crooks, to be represented as a missing heiress whose story they have read about in the papers.
A Greek man falls for an injured French woman. When he is informed of her death, he continues to sing under her hospital window every night.

A young girl, Rose Eastmen lives with her lazy Uncle, who works as a janitor in a publishing house. Lacking education, both Rose and her Uncle are susceptible to the socialist ideas of writer Rudolph Creig.
A 1917 film directed by Edward Dillon.
When Richard Hudson receives a pair of silk pajamas from a friend in China, he is unaware that they are bewitched and that whoever wears them will be transformed into someone else.
During a raging storm, a baby is washed up on shore on an island in Greece and is adopted by the wealthy Stanhopes, who name her Lorelei.

John Rand, having lived in a small town his entire life, dreams of possessing wealth and power in New York. Napoleon Bonaparte has long been his ideal, and one day he feels a message from the departed general urging him to take up the fight for world supremacy.
A nurse falls for a impoverished and recently blinded novelist.

James Brieson, a wealthy stockbroker, ruins Hutch Valiant, who soon after dies of the shock. Valiant's son Steele returns from the Northwest, where he won his fortune, just before his father's death and decides to devote his life to the cause of revenge.
Lois Fox, upon whose shoulder is branded a Chinese idiograph resembling the letters "A. Y.," is rescued from a gang of Chinese ruffians by Brice Ferris.
Andrea Minghetti runs a California vineyard with the help of his pretty niece Bona, who cooks for the employees.

Left alone and penniless after her father dies, Eileen Orton attempts suicide. Douglas Seward, who must be married to obtain the position he seeks, befriends Eileen and offers to support her if she will pose as his wife.
Having been misinformed that all French girls are morally suspect, American soldier David Kendall (Edwin August) is in for quite a shock when he's shipped Over There.
Chorus girl Rosa Carillo (Carmel Myers) finds herself in dire straits when the troupe she works with is disbanded and her last fifty dollars is stolen.
Upon receiving an inheritance from her late uncle, a woman starts a fortune-telling business designed to make her dreams come true.
A wealthy society playboy falls in love with the daughter of a poor fisherman. After Valentino shot to fame, A Society Sensation was cut down to a meek 24 minutes so the lead would be in every scene.
A married society couple (Dorian and Warren) persuade an unmarried pair (Valentino and Myers) to take their places at a party while they pretend to be the servants.
At the wedding ceremony in her Little Italy, New York neighborhood, Rosie flees to the settlement house where she meets Jerry Van Tyne, a wealthy young man who agrees, in a drunken state
A reporter is related the tale of a girl from an isolated colony descended from the English survivors of a shipwreck.
At a party thrown by millionaire Max Goldberg, Charles Howard, an aristocratic young artist, succumbs to the charms of chorus girl Lita O'Farrell, Goldberg's erstwhile girl friend.
Leona Williard works in a millinery shop in a small town while dreaming of going to New York and marrying a wealthy man.

Norine Lawton is a young woman living by her wits in New York City. When she becomes friendly with Count Bonzi, a swindler, he enlists her aid in his scheme to sell worthless Mercer oil company stock to wealthy Christopher Gibbons, a retired war hero.
Struggling Greenwich Village artist Jerry, marries studio helper, Jane Judd, who is an aspiring playwright, knowing that she will not interfere with his work.
Sonya Schnoema, a Jewish girl, comes to the United States as an immigrant and works in her father's ghetto grocery store, where she gains the affections of a young settlement worker, David Dahlman.

At the harvest fiesta, Don Luis Baldarama, owner of one of California's great ranchos, expects to announce the betrothal of his son, Audre, to Isabella Chavez, the daughter of a neighboring don named Miguel Chavez.
A city girl revenuer spies on illegal whiskey making in the hills.

Drifter Dick Manners arrives at a ranch owned by Colonel Angus McClelland. When he wagers that he will be able to ride a wild bronco and kiss the ranchman's haughty daughter, Jean -- and wins -- he lands a job there.
Steve Cline returns to the U.S. after earning his fortune in South America. He reads in the paper that his brother Tom was arrested for safecracking.
A silent film drama based on the Broadway play of the same name by James Forbes.
James Manning comes to Chicago to achieve his fortune.
Mary is given a job as a waitress in the commissary, and gets to meet 40 actors, actresses and directors, none of whom tip big enough to enable Mary to earn enough money to pay for an operation.
Poet Raphael de Valentin is down on his luck until a friend introduces him into society. He meets the Countess Fedora, and after she reads his poems, his work becomes an overnight sensation.
An Egyptian Princess is infatuated with Karmet, a Syrian prince who is disguised as a merchant. He, however, loves Arvia, a dancer.
After obtaining a divorce from his second wife Emily, Roy Tappan marries Dora Carson, who has just divorced her husband.
Margot Le Blanc loses her small fortune at Monte Carlo and makes the acquaintance of Hugh Kildair, an artist, who hires her as a housekeeper.

George Bryan Brummel, a British military officer, loves Lady Margery, the betrothed of Lord Alvanley. Despite her own desperate love for Brummel, she submits to family pressure and marries Lord Alvanley. Brummel, broken-hearted, embarks upon a life of revelry.
Ralph Norton, man-about-town and wealthy favorite in Broadway society circles, is attracted to Helen Tremaine, but her flirtatious behavior causes him to reject the superficial life of his set.
A small-town businessman bumbles into blackmail and a real-estate swindle.
Garragan is a 1924 German silent film directed by Ludwig Wolff and starring Edward Burns, Carmel Myers and Julanne Johnston.
A tour of the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studio in 1925 shows the people who make the movies there, and gives viewers a glimpse at how movies are made.
Erstwhile childhood friends, Judah Ben-Hur and Messala meet again as adults, this time with Roman officer Messala as conqueror and Judah as a wealthy, though conquered, Israelite.
Movie_Name: Ben-Hur: A Tale of the Christ

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A home movie version of the Dumas play. A young woman becomes a courtesan and tragedy befalls her.
Movie_Name: Camille: The Fate of a Coquette

Brief_Description_of_Movie: In 1913, Carl is released from prison, where he served a sentence for stealing. Spurned by his circumstance, Carl rejects God and resumes his fast life of crime.
U.S. Marine Sergeant O'Hara has his hands full training raw recruits, one of whom, 'Skeets' Burns, is a particular thorn in his side.
Trouble begins when Mme. Girard steps out on her husband, Criquette's father, to fool around with rakish Phillippe Levaux.
Two men in love with the same girl are trapped with her in a forest fire.
1927 picture starring Carmel Myers and Walter Pidgeon.

Stephen Sorrell, a decorated war hero, raises his son Kit alone after Kit's mother deserts husband and child in the boy's infancy. Sorrell loses a promising job offer and is forced to take work as a menial.
An aristocratic English womanizer is forced to take a fishing trip to avoid the husbands of his conquests, meets a young American lady on the train, and follows her to Biarritz.
After completing his prison sentence for killing a rival gang leader in self-defence, Benny Horowitz decides to go straight.

A duke has deposed Prince Mauritz's father, so Mauritz spends his time in affairs with a countess, the duke's wife and a gypsy girl Adrienne. Years later she is a famous actress in a play resembling the sad story of their earlier relationship.
Miriam Holt hopes to solve the disappearance of a million dollars in bonds allegedly stolen by her late uncle.

In French Indochina, a magistrate is assigned to investigate the murder of his boss. Unknown to him, the boss had a policy of requiring the wives of his subordinates to sleep with him if they wanted their husbands to get promoted.
Directed by John Griffith Wray. With Douglas Fairbanks Jr., Carmel Myers, Holmes Herbert, Kenneth Thomson.

Ted Howard, a vaudevillian left, stranded in a tank town. A local girl, Mary (Sally O'Neil), proposes to finance a new act with her savings and the team succeeds in a minor way until Ted is discovered by Broadway femme fatale Valeska (Carmel Myers).
Now hear this. The studio that gave the cinema its voice offered 1929 audiences a chance to see and hear multiple silent-screen favorites for the first time in a gaudy, grandiose music-comedy …
On a yacht sailing from Shanghai to the United States, the sailors, led by the megalomaniac steward, revolt and take control.

A wealthy industrialist's wife gets into a big argument with him; to cool off, she goes on an ocean trip. He thinks she's left him for good, so he marries another woman. When his first wife returns, complications ensue.
A music maestro uses hypnotism on a young model he meets in Paris to make her both his muse and wife.
A novelist and his younger brother fall in love with the same woman.
A crippled puppeteer rescues an abused young boy and turns the boy into a great ballet dancer.
The female head of a criminal gang in Chinatown is after a valuable jewel, and lets nothing stand in her way of finding it.
A mother tries to get her daughter to marry for money, but the daughter wants to marry for love.
An assistant district attorney tries to stop his girlfriend's father from being swindled out of his money by a crooked lawyer in a racetrack scam.
A distraught movie extra flees a movie set with a fancy costume and car.
Gambling boat operator Jenny Blake throws over her gambler beau Jack Morgan in order to marry into high society.
Leon Errol plans to buy a doll as a gift for his wife; misunderstandings ensue.
When beautiful Mary returns to her "whistle stop" hometown, long-standing feelings of animosity between two of her old boyfriends leads to robbery and murder.
An American radio–television anthology series, created in 1947 by Canadian director Fletcher Markle, who came to CBS from the CBC.
"Chico" successfully persuades cranky, bigoted garage owner Ed Brown to take him on as an employee and partner in the business and to live in the garage in Ed's old van.
Retired detective Nick Charles and his wife set out to solve a murder mystery after a corpse wearing white gloves is found in a hotel pool.
A would-be filmmaker and actress shake up the industry with a trick dog who gets discovered by a studio bus driver in the 1920s.
Movie_Name: Won Ton Ton: The Dog Who Saved Hollywood

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A biography of Erte, the early 20th century Russian artist and designer known for his glamorous opera sets, jewelry, costumes, and graphic arts. Narrated by Diana Vreeland.
The story of a poor young woman, separated by prejudice from her husband and baby, is interwoven with tales of intolerance from throughout history.
Movie_Name: Intolerance: Love's Struggle Throughout the Ages

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Instead of buying bonds, Lillian buys new clothes. Then she has a dream that her home has been invaded by German soldiers, and her family has been taken away.
Movie_Name: Lillian Gish in a Liberty Loan Appeal

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Daughter of impoverished vaudeville actor Lew Moore, Sheila works as a waitress in a chocolate manufacturer's candy shop, where she delights the customers with her tomboyish antics.

John Logan leaves his parents and sweetheart in bucolic Happy Valley to make his fortune in the city. Those he left behind become miserable and beleaguered in his absence, but after several years he returns, a wealthy man.
Ralph visits France with his father, a shipbuilder, and falls in love with Blossom, the granddaughter of his father's friend, a Civil war veteran not reconciled with the Union.
Movie_Name: The Girl Who Stayed at Home

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Susie secretly loves her neighbor, William Jenkins, but neither, it seems, can confess their feelings for each other.
Rosie Nell, a woman of disreputable dance halls in early lawless California, is wrongly charged with the murder of one of her fellow entertainers.
A man murders his wife's lover and escapes with his daughter to the South Pacific. A detective pursues him, joined by a young man who eventually falls in love with the daughter.
A naive country girl is tricked into a sham marriage by a wealthy womanizer, then must rebuild her life despite the taint of having borne a child out of wedlock.
Three men in London compete for the love of a dance-hall girl.
Sherlock Holmes is a master at solving the most impenetrable mysteries, but he has his work cut out for him on his latest case.
Suspected, shadowed, accused-Then they find each other.
A wealthy young Southern aristocrat, Joseph, graduates from a seminary and, before he takes charge of his assigned parish, decides to go out and see what "the real world" is all about.
The story of a family caught up in the American Revolutionary War.
A family from Poland has been left homeless in the wake of World War I. They move to Germany and struggle to survive the conditions there, during the Great Inflation.
Judge Foster throws his daughter out because she married a circus man. She leaves her baby girl with Professor McGargle before she dies.

Joan Royle, beautiful but naive model who came from the slums, falls for Fred Ketlar, the leader of a dance band. When Fred's estranged wife Adele is murdered, Fred is arrested and convicted of the crime.

Geoffrey is desperately in love with Mavis, who lives at his boardinghouse and is also pursuing a writing career. Unable to marry her because of his poverty, in his anger he curses God for abandoning him.

A young woman, confronted by four options for proceeding in her life, is granted the ability to see what results would come from her choice of of the options. After she sees her future along three of the roads, she makes her choice.
Laura Nesbit, daughter of old Dr. Nesbit and belle of the younger social set in the town of Harvey, plans to marry Grant Adams, the editor of the local paper, until she flirts with rising.
Movie_Name: In the Heart of a Fool

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A woman, having lost interest in her soon to be bankrupt husband, decides to seduce a doctor.
A rich woman and a poor man fall in love, but they face the opposition of her family.
Northwest Mounted Policemen Fitzgerald and Herrick, who are later joined by Indian guide Uncas, have been detailed to track down a gang of whiskey-runners.
An insecure wife fears her husband may be straying back to an old flame.
Professor Griggs, teaching at the college, doesn't get paid a living wage; his next door neighbor, successful shoemaker Olsen, has money and plentiful food, while the Griggses have hardly any.

According to this Lois Weber production, men don't really seem to know what they want at all -- first Frank (J. Frank Glendon) wants to be an inventor. Then he wants to marry his childhood sweetheart, Hallie (the lovely Claire Windsor).
Although renowned pediatrician Dr. Jim Keene loves his wife, Helen, she resents his devotion to his work and finds solace with other men. After the death of one of Jim’s young patients
Directed by Wallace Worsley.
The WAMPAS Baby Stars was a promotional campaign sponsored by the United States Western Association of Motion Picture Advertisers, which honored 13 (15 in 1932) young actresses
An outcast who runs a road house of ill repute leads his mother to believe him dead. His only friend, a doctor, falls for a married woman.
Tommy Frazer is one of a gang of crooks lead by "Tony the Wop". Frazer gets caught and is sent up the river for three years on a forgery rap.
When a woman friend's jewels are stolen, young Peter Wyndham is too afraid to try to stop the theft.
In managing the shipyard inherited from her father, Derith Keogh has considerable labor problems and accedes to the unreasonable demands of John Trevelyan, an anarchist labor agitator.
A wealthy minister in a mining town is something of an advocate for the miners' safety, but he doesn't really get involved in the issue.
A young woman hits Hollywood, determined to become a star.
Rudolf Rassendyll returns to Ruritania, to play the King once more. Lost Adaptation of the eponymous Anthony Hope nove, the sequel of the Prisoner of Zenda.
A doctor's adopted son turns out to be an ungrateful whelp. He beds the doctor's maid, then his secretary, and finally targets the doctor's wife, his own stepmother as his next conquest.
When a wealthy man is found murdered in his bedroom, one of his two adopted sons is arrested and charged with the killing. However, the verdict at his trial is an acquittal.
As a boy, Raoul is reared by an Arab tribe in Algerian Sahara.
Nellie Horton, when mistreated by her father, is taken in charge by Thomas Lipton. She grows up in poverty not knowing her true identity as the heiress to her mother's millions.
When a wealthy young lady leaves the US to visit her aunt in France, her husband falls in love with a "flapper". When the wife returns home, she finds out about her husband's affair.
Judge Roberts hides his true financial condition from his daughter, Virginia, whom he brings up in luxury by selling his estate a little at a time.
A lonely wife becomes obsessed with furs and keeps bad company in an effort to obtain more.
When Dorothy wants to marry Bob (Robert Agnew), her mother, Mildred, forbids the match. Dorothy angrily asserts that Mildred might reconsider if her own mother had forbid her marriage.
A tour of the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studio in 1925 shows the people who make the movies there, and gives viewers a glimpse at how movies are made.

During a carnival in Venice, Horace Pierpont, a wealthy American (Lewis Stone), falls in love with Fay Kennion (Virginia Valli). Their romance is derailed when she goes over to his apartment and finds the vampy Fifi (Nita Naldi) there.
May s married to Roger, an alcoholic hell-raiser. During one of their riotous parties, she tests his fidelity by impersonating a notorious masked dancer
Sam Starling (Owen Moore) is deep in debt, his wife Phoebe (Claire Windsor) is leaving him and still he is confident.
Three United States soldiers are lost in the Rhineland on Armistice Day and accepted as conquering overlords by a village... except for Lady Bountiful.
A girl travelling by train to meet her boyfriend meets another young man and falls in love with him.
The Iron Claw is a powerfully emotional movie with some outstanding acting in support of a very sad real-life story.
John Dale and Abner Hawkins are members of Andrew Jackson's Tennessee Militia, assigned to make peace with the Creek Indian tribe in general
Tale of a young bugler whose stepmother attempts to supplant the mother who only lives in his memory.
Part of a 7-part series exploring all aspects of Hollywood.
Capt. Robert Kelly holds off the foreign mob single-handed and makes good his escape during the Boxer rebellion.
Bonnie and Cliff meet cute when she gives him a lift after his car has broken down.
When theatrical producer Robert Chandler (E. Alyn Warren), believed drowned in a fishing accident, turns up as a lonely, broken amnesiac three months later
Hollywood actresses including Jeanette Loff and Raquel Torres modeling Spring fashions in color.
Hollywood hopeful Peggy Pepper arrives at a major studio, from Georgia, to become a great dramatic star. Things don't go entirely according to plan.
Lash is the head coal stoker on a steam ship whose shipmates have nicknamed "Captain". Lash somehow grabs the attention of society dame passenger Cora Nevins.
Following a successful experimental operation to reverse age, a wealthy businessman stages his own death and assumes the identity of his nephew.
Katy Devoux runs a gambling-drinking joint in British Columbia.
A young writer saves a desperate young woman from committing suicide. They eventually fall in love and marry, but their marriage faces some serious roadblocks.
A mother abandons her family only to become a crispy critter with her lover, the husband finds out about it AND that his son isn't really his, becomes an alcoholic
While the commander of the British Army in Arabia, Major J. W. Courtney, is out in the desert chasing marauding tribesmen, his wife carries on an affair with Captain Randall.
A man falls in love with a young woman, only to discover that she's the daughter of an ex-girlfriend who jilted him almost 20 years before.
Madcap couple George and Marion Kerby are killed in an automobile accident. They return as ghosts to try and liven up the regimented lifestyle of their friend and bank president, Cosmo Topper.
A pampered, snobbish young boy is sent by his father, John Hale, who has served time in prison for a crime he did not commit, down to the country.
Murder occurs when several of the most popular radio personalities of the '40s converge on a desert resort.

Marion Taylor is secretary to Edward Mallory, a wealth Wall Street businessman. She supports her invalid brother Tommy, who has been told by his doctors that he has to go to the mountains for his health.

Being the story of the Morgans, a 19th-century Massachusetts whaling family, their tightly-knit Quaker community, and the dangerous adventures of an unwilling stowaway aboard one of the elder Morgan's harvest vessels.
Movie_Name: Down to the Sea in Ships

Brief_Description_of_Movie: The dashing but arrogant Prince Michael Fedor Lubimoff has to flee Tsarist Russia after falling into disgrace and settles in Monte Carlo, where he resumes
Charlie is a small town druggist trying to wait on trade and play a social game of poker in the back room.
Cabaret dancer Suzie La Motte (Harris) is in love with Jim Moran (King), a boxer, but she tempts a young man named John Browning (Mack).
Ethel Shannon and Harrison Ford (the silent star, not Indiana Jones) are young lovers in Pre-Civil-War New York, but he is a poor gardener working for her rich
A Manhattan playboy falls for a mysterious European woman, whom he notices is an exact double for a famous socialite who disappeared at the turn of the century.
Two former childhood gang members, "Kid" Hart and Orchid McGonigle, attempt to go straight, despite pressure to continue their lives of lawlessness.
Margot Le Blanc loses her small fortune at Monte Carlo and makes the acquaintance of Hugh Kildair, an artist, who hires her as a housekeeper.

Newly rich Mark Hadley drifts from his old-fashioned wife into a secret liason with Lila Millas, a pretty French girl. At the same time, he advises his daughter, Marjory, to break her ties with Kent Merrill.
John Warriner, facing financial ruin, accepts the proposal of a bootlegger, Benedict, to underwrite the business of illegal wine-selling.

Milt Kimberlin is a down-on-his luck horse owner, but Rosalie, a cabaret performer (the lively and engaging Clara Bow), doesn't care -- she turns down the fancy jewelry offered by oily Frank Gorman for a wedding ring from Kimberlin.

A young man, who has vowed never to marry and doesn't particularly like children, is left in charge of his two very young nieces. At first they drive him to distraction, but then he begins to warm to them, and also to a beautiful young local girl.

This Woman is a 1924 American drama film directed by Phil Rosen, written by Louis D. Lighton and Hope Loring, and starring Irene Rich, Ricardo Cortez, Louise Fazenda, Frank Elliott, Creighton Hale, and Marc McDermott.
A WWI drama in which a Red Cross dog saves a man.
This is not a Clara Bow vehicle, and yet it is clearly the aspect/asset of Clara Bow which elevates a fairly serious melodrama to a timeless and profound social statement.
A young man spends so much time at work on his airplane that he neglects his girl. She goes out on her own to live the high life, but her reputation is soiled by an adventurer.
A newspaper publisher finds out that his wild daughter has fallen in with a ring of gamblers.
Austin Starfield (Louis) has his greedy eye on a steel mill belonging to Eve Burnside (Rich).
Disguised as a boy, a young woman gets an inner-city street gang back on the straight and narrow path.
Cardelanche, the son of an Indian chief, returns from the East to find himself rejected by his own people.
Street people Armand and Marie are madly in love, and she persuades Armand and other gang members to rob the home of Pierre Marcel, a wealthy scientist.
Gaston Fleury's wife, Loulou, takes a perfunctory interest in music but a deeper one in a musician named Maurice.
A bee keeper does his best to help the army.

Alcoholic playboy Wallace MacDonald (as Bruce Armstrong) would like to sober up and become more responsible, after a drinking accident causes him to cripple little brother Pat Moore (as Jimmy Armstrong).
A young woman is released from the reformatory where she was unjustly sent. She starts a new life with the help of a judge and an idealistic young minister.
Visiting his vast properties incognito, Hugh Nichols (Tom Mix) discovers that his land agent (Cyril Chadwick) is forcing Peggy Swain (Clara Bow) and her dad
A Whimsical Flapper. Aspiring author, Clara Bow (as Prudence "Prue" Severn) leaves her staid home for the wild life in New York's artistic Greenwich Village
Hugh Carver is an athletic star and a freshman at Prescott College. He falls in love with Cynthia Day, a popular girl who loves to go to parties.
On the night before they are to elope, an old sailor gives Brant a strange potion to drink and then unfolds before his eyes "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner."
A young woman is framed and sent to prison for a crime she didn't commit. When she is released, she sets out to take her revenge on those responsible.
Dorothy Hammis (Bow), the daughter of wealthy financier John Hammis (Fawcett), has chosen as her fiance James Radley (Forrest), but her father disproves of him.
An unfaithful husband and his daughter go on nightly club outings, leaving the mother at home. The mother rebels against her lonesome life and attempts to prevent a man from pursuing her daughter.
Playboy Teddy Ward wants to marry Jeannie King, an artist, but his father wants him to marry Loris Lane
A movie actress, mistakenly thinking she has killed a fellow actor, goes on the run and finds herself taken in by a Kentucky mountain family.
A sexy young manicurist living with her older backwoodsman husband in a small Canadian town finds herself attracted to a young, rich and famous divorce

A salesman is helped out of a jam with an angry customer by a wealthy playboy. In return, he agrees to help the playboy get a divorce from his wife, only to find himself falling for the girlfriend of the customer who got him in trouble in the first place.
A flapper shopgirl woos her rich boss with animal magnetism, otherwise known as "it."
Two adults (Clara Bow, Gary Cooper) have trouble committing to marriage because of the pain suffered during their parents' divorces.
A poor but ambitious young girl is determined to crash high society, but isn't prepared for the reception she receives.
Two young men, one rich, one middle class, both in love with the same woman, become US Air Corps fighter pilots and, eventually, heroic flying aces during World War I.
The daughter of a pineapple plantation owner in Hawaii sets her sights on a married English engineer.
A young American girl in Paris falls in love with a handsome nobleman, but he is about to wed in an arranged marriage.
This girl with red hair finds true love in a drug king pin. She fell in love with his money, but he blows it all on beer and pizza.
A dead criminal's daughter falls in love with a small-time crook and tries to get him to reform before he winds up like her father.
A girl who works in a dance hall falls in love with a sailor, but he has the wrong idea of what it is she does and doesn't want anything to do with her.
A sexy young nightclub singer sets her sights on a young man she believes to be a millionaire playboy, although he is in reality only an insurance agent.
Wild girls at a college pay more attention to parties than their classes. But when one party girl, Stella Ames, goes too far at a local bar and gets in trouble, her professor has to rescue her.
Dangerous Curves is an entertaining circus soap opera. Hunky Richard Arlen plays an extremely talented and popular trapeze artist.

Mayme and sister Janie are salesgirls in Ginsberg's Department Store. Mayme is in love with store clerk Bill, but Janie tries to steal him from her. Hazel, another salesgirl, is Jean Harlow's first credited role.
This 1930 film, a collection of songs and sketches showcasing Paramount Studios' contract stars, credits 11 directors.

Ruby is a counter girl at the San Diego Soda Shop with a habit of being a girlfriend to Sailors stopping by. Things get a little zany when she sets her eyes on Bull's Eye McCoy a gunner who refuses to settle down.
A young waitress falls for the son of a railroad tycoon, and finds herself hobnobbing with the rich when he invites her to spend some time with he and his family in Palm Springs.

Norma Martin is an American movie star in France trying to avoid the attention of men. Going to visit a friend in Southern France, she finds herself "married" to a playboy song writer Ralph Forbes she hadn't yet met.
Theater usherette Bunny O'Day (Clara Bow) inadvertently becomes hostess of a private gambling den, and gets involved in a romance with a ne'er-do-well gambler.
Toomey is released from prison, his wife Bow waiting for him.
Sexy Texas gal storms her way through life, brawling and boozing until her luck runs out, forcing her to learn the errors of her ways.
A hula dancer at a carnival sets out to seduce the naive son of the show's manager.

This entry of Screen Snapshots travels to Las Vegas, Nevada, and Ralph Staub visits and talks to many Hollywood notables as they arrive at the famed gambling city and vacation at a dude-ranch resort and spa.
Commemorates the centennial of American movies with a montage of clips and music scores from the most important movies of the century.
Clara Bow: Discovering the 'It' Girl features scenes from 25 of her films, as well as interviews with family members and acquaintances.
Movie_Name: Clara Bow: Discovering the It Girl

Brief_Description_of_Movie: In ancient Athens, four young lovers escape into the woods.
Directed by J. Stuart Blackton.

Making his departure from home. Captain Jack of the Confederate army, leaves to rejoin his regiment, but before doing so promises his boy that he will return to celebrate the little fellow's fifth birthday.
Movie_Name: Ransomed; or, A Prisoner of War

Brief_Description_of_Movie: The story of how Lady Godiva came to ride naked through the streets of Coventry.

King Henry VIII smitten with Anne Boleyn wishes to displace his estimable Queen Catherine for her. He appeals to Cardinal Wolsey to set aside the tenets of the Church and consent to his divorce from the Queen.
After a night at the club, old Boggs returns home, filled with good cheer and spirit.
Dr. Lafleur is convinced that crime is an illness and can be treated like that.
A short comedy about a girl (played by Clara Kimball Young) who is in love with a movie star (Maurice Costello) and who follows him everywhere.

A little country village comedy in which Mr. Costello plays a young grocer's clerk. This clerk and the daughter (Clara Kimball Young) of a G.A.R. fire-eater (Mr. Eldridge) are in love, much to the old man's disgust.
Rising young physician John Lewis is in love with Madge Marion. He gets an offer to share a practice in New York and proposes marriage; Madge consents.
A widower with four grown daughters remarries and brings his new wife home to meet them. The girls set out to make life as difficult as possible for their new mother.
Three part chronicle of how the rumor of war triggers greed in some men and the comeuppance they suffer because of hubris.
After her husband dies at sea, Madeline travels to the city to study sculpture but her tutor has a more than professional interest in her.
In the college play, Tom and his room-mate, "Bunch," take prominent and successful parts, Tom as the hero and "Bunch" as the heroine, in which he is an excellent female impersonator.
After meeting a handsome writer, Senator Carter's daughter leaves home and enters the employ of the Vitagraph Company as an actress.
Virginia Jameson, a girl of lovely disposition, is wooed by a man much older than herself whom she very much dislikes, but who stands very high in the favor of her parents.
A glimpse of the life of a few lodgers in a boarding house, focusing on the young couple Mr and Mrs Edison.
A farce in which Dick Edna wants to learn the art of seduction, and takes lessons for this from the brother of his beloved.
To start a little in advance of our story, Lord Rintoul, of the English nobility, finds a little Gypsy girl three years old, who had been deserted by her parents.
Tired of being sought only for his money, a rich man goes on a fishing trip.
Movie_Name: What a Change of Clothes Did

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A strike among the hotel waiters is on. The papers are full of it. Chester Colton, and Harris Baldwin, young college chaps, read that waiters are needed in all the big hotels and restaurants.
A comic one-act film featuring the character Bunny, which takes place in an office.
In the early part of the Nineteenth Century, Beau Brummell was the most talked-of person in all the world, the extreme of fashion, the personification
A short film directed by James Young and starring Charles Kent & Clara Kimball Young.

Becoming impatient waiting for patients, young Doctor Bob Lyons is about discouraged. To add to his misery, his sweetheart's father, Mr. Irving, distinctly objects to Emily, his daughter, marrying Bob until he has a practice.
A comedy short directed by James Young and starring Clara Kimball Young and himself.
It is sometimes decidedly difficult to get a little privacy on shipboard. Several times Jack Hardy almost reaches the proposal point with Marion Van Sickles, but each time the fates are against him.
A young American millionaire in Venice falls in love with the beautiful princess Ione.

Advised by his friends to seek a second wife so that his children, Helen and Dolores, may know a mother's care, Sir Edward Tilbury marries Phyllis, the daughter of Lady Olivia Gower, a leading social light in Calcutta.
Using hypnosis and two agents, Jerry manages to get rid of his mother in law.
Miss Marbury comes on deck and looks haughtily at Mrs. Cray, an attractive young widow, half suspecting that she has her steamer chair.
A short comedy in which the husband concocts a jealousy story to make an impression on his wife.
The Simpsons go for a picnic in the woods. After luncheon, while mother and father enjoy a nap, Betty, their beautiful daughter, strolls away, picking flowers.
Clara Kimball Young, batting her eyelashes even faster than Bernadette Peters, plays Gwendoline, an innocent(?) heroine who seeks a livelihood in the big city.

The Baron Lafitte is in love with and proposes to Adelaide Burton, daughter of Andrew Burton, a wealthy manufacturer. Clara Lane, a newspaper reporter, has been assigned to watch the movements of the Baron.

This LOST film was Clara Kimball Young's first feature, and her last film for Vitagraph, where she had made all of her short films. It was a sensational success and launched her as the most popular star that year.
During the Franco-Prussian War, a violin teacher gets separated from his daughter. He spends years wandering across Europe looking for her.
Three part adventure serial starring Clara Kimball Young. Chapter Titles: 1. "Treachery in the Clouds" 2. "The Treasure Temple of Bhosh" 3. "A Race for Life"

Both deadly rivals for the hand of the Widow Hathaway, Kirkland and Livingston, gentleman farmers, are so bitter, they do all possible to break up the love match between Dick and Florence, their respective children, causing great unhappiness.
A scientist resurrects his dead daughter, only to realize she now lacks a soul.
In Czarist Russia, attractive Anna Ivanovna has consecrated her life to work among Russia's persecuted poor. She dispenses food, medicine, and funds to the needy, from a busy charity headquarters.
This 1915 Maurice Tourneur film is a version of the famous du Maurier novel. It was later done in a more famous 1931 film named Svengali with John Barrymore.
Camille is a courtesan in Paris. She falls deeply in love with a young man of promise, Armand Duval.

In Paris Mildred White becomes romantically involved with both Derwent Ainsworth and Dr. Mario Martinez. She prefers Derwent, but when he leaves suddenly to see his dying father, Mario convinces Mildred that he has deserted her.
A 1916 film.
Based on the Novel by Robert W. Chambers of New York City life among the upper-crust, Valerie West , artist/model and philosopher, undergoes much sorrow and joy.
Susan takes the place of model and shows the clothes so well that she is asked to impersonate a Countess at a reception given by a customer.
A young actress seeks an engagement in New York but faces obstacles due to jealousy and politics. Her wealthy broker finances a production, demanding her best role.
Magda (Young) rebels against the harsh treatment she receives from her stern father (Edward Kimball). She ultimately escapes from home with aspirations to become a singer.
Clara Kimball Young stars as Mary Saurin, a British gentlewoman who journeys to South Africa to visit her district-commissioner brother Dick (Henry Woodward).

Gabrielle Jardee, daughter of a conservative Parisian family, is in love with an American, John Morgan, who her parents disapprove of. She is sent away from Paris to a small village, where her aunt lives with her sister and brother.
Shows brief glimpses into the lives of movie stars of the time. Included is shots of Elsie Janis in her garden in Tarrytown, where she gives an impersonation of Mary Pickford.
Two gangs of crooks, living side-by-side, each mistake the other for a wealthy household and each plot to rob the other.

Charmian Page has developed a great affection for the child of Sir Richard. When the child is seriously hurt in a car crash that has killed his mother Lady Beverly, who was on her way to see her lover, Charmian persuades her wealthy father to pay for the operation that saves the child.
A young woman at a crossroads is shown what her future would be like for each choice.
A beautiful French actress is the unwitting force behind the suicide of one of her admirers. A scandal erupts, threatening to destroy her reputation.
A woman (Clara Kimball Young) reluctantly agrees to marry a wild boozer (Bertram Grassby).

The title means nothing more than the mid-channel of married life, through a character in the feature likening the roughness of the English channel in the center of the trip across from London to Paris to the woes married folks meet in their wedded life.
A woman finds her marriage on the rocks after she reveals to her husband some but not all the details of her one-time relationship with a current associate of his.
A young man takes a trip to Europe, and when he returns home he brings along the woman he fell in love with and became engaged to.
A woman's excessive spending brings difficulty to her family.
Ms. Young portrays two roles. As Janet, a convent novitiate, she agrees to exchange places with her sister, Lucy, a cabaret dancer, who believes she has killed a man.
Directed by Wallace Worsley.
Joyce Addison, wife of an American attache in Madrid, looks to her painting as sole entertainment, as her husband neglects her for business.
Duplicitous Patricia Chase schemes to break up the new marriage of Margery and Wallace Graham because she yearns for Wallace despite her marriage to another.
A former All-American football star, now working as a steel mill supervisor in New Jersey, falls in love with the mill owner's wealthy, very spoiled daughter.
A young man is shocked to discover that his mother has been running an illegal gambling den for most of his life.
Stars of Yesterday documentary film.
A gold-digging woman wins a big settlement against an older married man, which threatens to destroy the man's family.
Janet Holman is suspicious of her fiancé, Allen Wells, after he kisses her best friend Gwen when the lights are turned out during a party.
A Parisian cop sets out to solve a sudden series of crimes, including robbery and blackmail.
An ex-convict, unable to get a good job because of his prison record, gets mixed up in a phony stock scam.
The publisher of a tabloid-type romance magazine decides to get some publicity by sponsoring a "Cinderella and Prince Charming" contest.
The Black Magic cult of Ubasti needs to kidnap the last known living princess from Egypt so they can sacrifice her to their cat god.
A mystic (Bela Lugosi) goes to an island to try to rescue an Egyptian princess (Maria Alba) from a sorcerer.
An unscrupulous lawyer uses alcohol to swindle an innocent family.
A short semi-documentary about a "typical extra girl" on a DeMille film.
An efficient secretary at a department store marries her boss, but discovers that taking care of him at home is a lot different to taking care of him at work.
When a meek purchasing agent is told by a quack doctor that he only has three months to live, he gets involved with a bank robbery and kidnapped by the gang.
A radical campus group persuades student Carol Arlington to lead a protest of a college's football team.
The Three Stooges are working as exterminators but when business is slow they decide to plant the insects themselves, which just leads to trouble.
While a ship captain is at sea dealing with a mutiny among his crew, his wife is at home having an affair with his best friend.
The story of a kindly old lady, her involvement with midget race cars and their drivers.
An evil gang is involved in both cattle rustling and the robbing of stagecoaches.
A mad killer is on the loose in a hotel on a dark, gloomy night. Robert F. Hill.
Oh, Susanna! is a 1936 American Western musical film directed by Joseph Kane and starring Gene Autry, Smiley Burnette, and Frances Grant.
Government agents try to thwart smugglers, while some sort of plot unfolds, about a hidden treasure revealed by cursed coins.

Aa Columbia 2-reel comedy starring Tom Kennedy and Monty Collins in NEW NEWS (1937). Fans of the 3 Stooges will recognize the exact same plot and situations from their short CRASH GOES THE HASH (1944).
An evil deputy is using Indian half-breeds to rustle cattle. This causes trouble between the cattlemen and Indians.
A detective poses as a jewel thief and joins a bunch of other crooks sailing from Europe to New York in search a famous gem. He falls in love with one of the crooks.
A hard-working woman trying to support her family and working at a menial, low-paying job falls for a low-life and before she knows it, he has her working.
The local school is causing Hoppy problems. First Bar 20 cattle are stolen when Hoppy investigates a problem there.
A woman's (Patricia Morison) believed-dead cowhand beau (Preston Foster) shows up on her wedding day to cause trouble.
A couple attempts to win custody of their orphaned grandson, who's being raised by his veterinarian uncle in a racetrack environment.
The edition of Screen Snapshots celebrates 25 years of production.
A collection of old-time silent movies, re-scored and narrated, featuring the most popular silent film stars.
Arnold Gray, a fighter against child labor and other social ills, comes under the influence of Rhoda Lewis
The surviving reels of Reckless Youth, a cautionary tale for aspiring flappers produced in New York by Selznick Pictures before its big move to Hollywood.
When Florette, a popular actress, and her friend Edith become rivals for the love of Walter Stanley, a leading man
Men try to understand the women in their lives.
Lee Randon, weary of business duties and a conventional home life, acquires a long-lost sense of excitement and romance with young flapper Claire Morris.
New York police are investigating the kidnapping of twenty wealthy girls.
Having a municipal position, Bernard Ingals has almost bankrupted himself sending his three children to college.
Young and head-strong New York flapper Georgie May Stockwell,, visits the Thurman ranch and vamps every man on the place, including Cal Thurman, ...
A mother and her son's lives are upended by the arrival of a wealthy flapper to their small New England fishing village.
In a wealthy society family, the mother is forced to sit by and watch while her husband and son both compete for the affections of a pretty young temptress.

A famous opera singer lost her voice when her son was born, and has drowned her sorrows in drink. When a murder is committed near her house, she invents a story in order to get herself back in front of the public again.

A young woman, victim of a scandal involving her lover believed killed in France during war, is loved by another man who urges her to marry him. After they are married, the husband becomes jealous of the lost lover.
Joel Parker is sent to college by his crabby farmer father only because it was his mother's dying wish that he get an education.
Three women performing in a Broadway show face temptation, love, money, betrayal and tragedy as the cost of fame.
A couple endure 365 days of marriage in order to inherit money.
Connie Hayden (Constance Bennett) faces a dilemma; will she choose the rich guy or the ordinary Joe? Naturally, Connie has the answer in time for the final credits.
A romance runs into difficulties because the girl has seen a great deal of the turbulence in her sister's household, and has no illusions about married bliss.
A Chinese posing as an American goes to Monte Carlo where he falls in love with Alanna, who later goes berserk upon learning his true identity.
The action takes place during the Great War in the home of the First Lord of the Admiralty.
Young Ellen Neal gets work as a servant with the wealthy Fullerton family and falls in love with their handsome young son.
A plain secretary works for a womanizing divorce lawyer who only dates married women.
Laura from a poor family rejects her boyfriend for a wealthy older man. She falls for a younger journalist, leaves the wealthy man but struggles financially.
A nurse (Constance Bennett) marries a nobleman (Paul Cavanagh) in World War I London when she hears her child's father (Joel McCrea) has been shot down.
When a woman models for an artist they fall in love. Can the artist overcome the beauty's recent past as another man's mistress?
Working-class girl Stephanie Dale dreams of living a better life and a chance to break into high society is more important than anything else for her.
A wealthy girl hires a male escort to make one of her male friends jealous. She spreads rumours about her character that makes her popular amongst all bachelors in the city including her friend.
The career of a waitress takes off when she meets an amiable drunken Hollywood director.
A woman from high society must testify in a murder trial prosecuted by her suitor.
A Broadway actress with a problematic past falls hard for the author of her new play.
Soon after being wed, American heiress Lady Pearl Grayston realizes her husband has married her for her money and is keeping a mistress.
A girl from the wrong side of the tracks is torn between true love and a life of sin.
A captain in the Austrian intelligence service is assigned to capture K-14, a clever spy who has so far managed to remain undetected.
A singer marries a famous composer, and after a while she gets the itch to go back on the stage. However, her husband won't let her.
The 16th-century sculptor woos the Duchess of Florence despite the duke.
A woman's dubious past proves to be a stumbling block when she becomes engaged to marry.
A news editor investigates a socialite's murder. He falls for Sharon Norwood, using her connections to the wealthy to aid his inquiry.
Basically this is a commercial for Hollywood's Lido Lounge and for MGM contract players.
The story, starring Constance Bennett and Douglass Montgomery, involves a Canadian POW being hidden by a German citizen during World War I.
Three working girls in Budapest pool their resources to get a better apartment and impress their dates.
Constance Bennett demonstrates her morning skin care and make-up regimen.

Madcap couple George and Marion Kerby are killed in an automobile accident. They return as ghosts to try and liven up the regimented lifestyle of their friend and bank president, Cosmo Topper. When Topper starts to live it up, it strains relations with his stuffy wife.

A tour of Hollywood, featuring such star frequented spots as the Vendome, the Lakeside Golf Club, the West Side Tennis Club, the Santa Anita Racetrack, the Ambassador Hotel's Cocoanut Grove, the Biltmore Bowl, and the American Legion Stadium.
Society matron Emily Kilbourne has a habit of hiring ex-cons and hobos as servants.
The manager of a service agency for the wealthy clashes with--and falls for--an inventor who is seeking funding for a new kind of tractor.
To gain entry to Heaven, a ghost attempts to reunite a divorcing couple as a good deed.
Flyer enters a cross-country aerial derby, becomes rival to a wealthy society flyer, competes in parachute jumps and has love affairs.
The story is given timeliness by placing the characters on a British merchant ship on the very day that World War II is declared.
An inventor in a managerial position on a rubber plantation in South America, he wants to bring back a wife, so the two make a deal.
After a ski instructor catches her husband flirting with an old flame, she decides to pose as her (fictitious) twin sister in an attempt to keep him ...
Fifth film in the Hedda Hopper documentary series.
