Truck driver Norman Foster has aspirations to become a prize fighter, but romantic interest June Clyde finds the idea deplorable. Henry Armetta and ZaSu Pitts supply the laughs.
Thelma and Zasu go to a Turkish bath to try to get rid of a cold.
A poor but honest and hardworking waitress from way across the tracks meets and falls in love with a college student from the upper-stuffy class, but the Mama of the intended objects to the romance.
Brant frames Destry and has men testify against him. Found guilty he vows to return. Back from prison he goes after the man that framed him.
Zasu inadvertently turns Thelma's vaudeville act into a shambles.
Vivienne Ware is defended by her ex-beau when she's accused of killing her faithless fiance.
Bodies start mysteriously disappearing from the city morgue. An investigator tries to determine what is going on.
A struggling writer divorces his wife to pursue his career without interference, but they meet in Europe years later after she has remarried.
Thelma and Zazu are on a leisurely excursion in a borrowed car. Thelma lets Zazu drive.
Poster writes a gossip column for the Morning Gazette. He will write about anyone and everyone as long as he gets the credit. He gets most of his information from his gal, Peggy who is a showgirl.
A grocery clerk, longing to become a cowboy actor, goes to Hollywood in search of fame and fortune. Unfortunately, his acting ability is non-existent.
A boatload of Westerners is trapped in Manchuria as bandits led by Russian renegade Voronsky ravage the area.
A woman's love for and devotion to a married man results in her being relegated to the "back streets" of his life.

Todd, Pitts, and their singing monkey are out-of-work vaudevillians eating an apple for dinner when they get a call from their agent telling them to be at the train station in an hour: they have a gig.

New York City tenement dwelling neighbors Blondie and Lottie are longtime best friends. When Lottie makes the cast of the Follies and moves up in the world, she arranges for Blondie, as well, to join the cast and gain the advantages.
When Thelma is stopped by a cop for speeding, she tries to get out of it by telling him that she and Zasu are on their way to the hospital.
A group of amateur detectives sets out to expose The Crooked Circle, a secretive group of hooded occultists.
Story of a Hollywood studio during the transition from silents to talkies.
Zasu and Thelma are working their way through college by selling magazine subscriptions. Finding little success going door-to-door, they decide to use their charms to sell to men at their workplaces.
Eddie Burke is a wise-guy pugilist whose talent is unevenly matched by his ego. Despite his character flaws, Eddie knows the meaning of loyalty.
A juror accidentally swallows a piece of evidence which just happens to be a time bomb in this comedic short.
Both the maid and the youngest daughter are after the same man who wants nothing to do with either of them.
Molly Hull, a maid, and Sam Sutton, a butler, are bequeathed a million dollars, and they encounter many problems and difficulties as they try to become the newest members of the idle rich.
Movie_Name: They Just Had to Get Married

Brief_Description_of_Movie: The girls moonlight as taxi dancers in order to earn some extra money.
Instead of delivering some fancy dresses to a customer, the girls wear them to a party.
Its 1850 and California is under ruthless military rule. Kirby Tornell's rancho has been taken over by soldiers and when two of Kirby's men are captured, he goes there to free them.

On their way to a bargain sale, Thelma and Zazu are pulled over by a motorcycle cop. Zazu poses as the police lieutenant's daughter, and they enlist the cop, Butterworth, to help them buy merchandise at the sale.
A "mama's boy" falls for a spinster who takes care of children at a department store nursery.
Peggy and her friend Millie are strolling down Broadway while Jimmy and Mac are trolling Broadway, and the four get together.
Thelma wins a screen test with a Hollywood studio, but trouble ensues on the train trip out there.

Radio singer Glory Eden is publicized as the ideal of American womanhood, in order to sell the sponsor's product Ippsie-Wippsie Washcloths. In reality, Glory would like to at least sample booze, jazz, gambling, and men.
A camp butcher on an Albany night boat dreams of the South Seas.
A lawyer devises a plan to fake a breach of contract suit against a wealthy womanizer.
Tough Aggie gives a street guy polish and a rich kid gumption.
A charlatan posing as Baron Munchhausen is invited to be guest speaker at a girls' school.
After losing their Missouri home during the Great Depression, the Skitch family pulls up stakes and heads west to California to begin life anew.
The wife of attorney John Blair (T. Jerome Lawler), heroine Helene (Kalich) finds herself in an untenable position when two of Blair's clients, Harry Carson (Robert Rendel)) and Richard
Sylvester Stallone stars as hard-luck big-rig trucker Lincoln Hawk and takes us under the glaring Las Vegas lights for all the boisterous action

Political graft collector, David Power forced by the district attorney to leave New York takes cabaret singer Hebe Norse with him. Showing talent in a variety of professions, Power is eventually hired by a great steel manufacturer, Gail Rogers.

Jack Duncan returns from the war in France to his wife and baby and learns that his job as a draftsman at the Loring Steel Mills has been taken. Given work in the machine shop, Jack becomes the prey of Red agitators who want him because of his popularity with soldiers.

Struggling artist Ned Templeton and his wife Joan are leading a poverty-stricken life in Paris. Threatened by starvation and eviction, Joan is forced to become a prostitute. After some time, Ned becomes successful, and he and Joan move to New York.
A young man who has proven a failure in business goes to Alaska and enters the salmon-fishing industry, in direct competition with the father of the woman he loves.
A Canadian Mountie allows an innocent fugitive to escape with the women he loves.
The story of the ill-fated romance between Solomon, king of Israel, and the Queen of Sheba.
A woman's excessive spending brings difficulty to her family.
The story of British prime minister Benjamin Disraeli and the purchase by England of the Suez Canal.
Countess Margherita is a Sicilian girl who is about to be married, but Caesar Maruffi, the head of a criminal syndicate, wants her for himself.
silent drama featuring Betty Blythe, Robert Frazer, and Gladys Hulette

Helen Frazer marries Harold Lawton to please her domineering grandmother. However, Harold continues his dalliance with chorus girl Letty Lorraine, and embezzles $25,000 from his employer, Howard Hendricks, to support her luxurious tastes.

He picked a Viennese company hoping to break into the English market. Wilcox says he was unhappy with the story he was given so he decided to make his own story. Wilcox found filming in Vienna difficult.
In Baghdad a girl escapes from a robber sheikh and thwarts a plot to rob a merchant.
A sequel of sorts, the Jewish ethnic comedy characters of Potash and Perlmutter return from their 1923 debut film, also produced by Goldwyn, but with a different actor for Potash.
Movie_Name: In Hollywood with Potash and Perlmutter

Brief_Description_of_Movie: This drama had two directors: Maurice Elvey handled most of the film, but the fantasy sequence was directed by Henry Otto.
Western melodrama about a sheltered youth who makes his way out West by playing the fiddle.
She is a joint British and German production that was shot in Berlin and it shares production design elements with expressionist films of the time.
All wind up snowbound together in a mountain lodge. Assuming he is marrying a wealthy girl, Peter Foley passes a fraudulent check.
To satisfy her controlling mother and secure both of their futures, a daughter hesitantly enters a loveless marriage to a wealthy businessman.

Mary Davis, alone and destitute in New York City, pilfers a meal from a restaurant and eludes the police by ducking into the Cafe Royale, where she is shuffled along a line of aspiring chorines awaiting job interviews.
Twin brothers James and Horace Bullard have opposite personalities.

Vitaphone production reels #2471-2478; third Warner Bros. feature film - the first being The Jazz Singer and the second Tenderloin - to include talking sequences, along with the by now usual Vitaphone musical score and sound effects.
Thomas Blaisdell, alias Western Evans, conceals his life as leader of a group of refined crooks from his daughter, Florence. Clayton Taggart, a young lawyer, falls in love with Florence
Young London realtor Leonard Tavernake becomes involved with two sisters, one good and one evil, which leads to much melodrama but things work out in the end.
The story of a girl whose past casts a shadow over her future happiness with the man who loves her. How much of her past must a girl tell the man she wants to marry?
Stars of Yesterday documentary film.

Young Lena Rivers, who was born out of wedlock, goes to live with a rich uncle. Unfortunately, her uncle's wife and daughter make no secret of their dislike of Lena and that they don't want her in their family.
Boy who thought his father a war hero finds he was really a deserter.
A woman's love for and devotion to a married man results in her being relegated to the "back streets" of his life.
A mother from Arkansas is very possessive of her grown son. To prevent him from getting married she has him drafted into WW I.

On the back of the Wall Street Crash of 1929, a young business man is about to commit suicide. With the note to his wife scribbled down and a gun in his hand, he notices a thick envelope addressed to him at the desk.
A man predicts his own death from an ancestral curse and winds up dead and Ralph Bellamy is the detective who has to solve the crime in the 1933 Columbia quasi-horror film
Neil Rogers, a young man who owns a substantial share of a Western gold mine, comes East and falls in love with the rather wild Elizabeth Vandegrift.
Bob Gordon comes from a rich background but wants make it on his own. He dreams of becoming a newspaper reporter and he eventually gets his chance.
At Joe's Roadside, a popular but rundown New York roadhouse where the wealthy and not-so-wealthy hang out, a wealthy Manhattan girl and a struggling Brooklyn boy meet and fall in love.
In the seventeenth century, in Massachusetts, a young woman is forced to wear a scarlet "A" on her dress for bearing a child out of wedlock.
Most frustrating about Two Heads on a Pillow (1934) was that the female lawyer didn't see the hypocrisy in her argument as it related to how her own marriage was ruined.
Elnora Comstock is the badly abused daughter of Katherine Comstock, who blames her because her father was drowned while on the way home the night she was born.
A reporter itching to get off the boring gardening "beat" gets a chance to investigate a series of arson fires that have been plaguing the city.
Romantic problems of a society girl and an engineer.
Mona Stewart, madcap, spoiled daughter of a wealthy man, becomes upset when she learns that her father is engaged to a woman she hates.
To draw attention to a popular show, a publicity expert hires a former carnival character, not knowing that the man is on the run from the law.
Ellery Queen's vacation is interrupted when murder strikes next door to his oceanside cabin.

Wealthy Henry Hanley takes his family to a dude ranch. But his daughter Gloria's boyfriend Eric is waiting and he is after Hanley's money. Ken overhears Eric's plan and abducts Gloria to stop the elopement.
A famous detective is invited to a swanky party at an elegant mansion, but before the night is over he finds himself involved with gangsters, blackmail and murde
Casino operator Johnny Lamb hires down-on-her-luck socialite Lucille Sutton as his casino hostess, in order to help her and to improve casino income.
The Gorgeous Hussy was based on a popular historical novel about Peggy O'Neal Eaton, a sassy innkeeper's daughter who gained political power in the 1830s
A young boy is forced to leave his family in the South and move in with relatives he doesn't know in New York.
Two reporters pose as man and wife in order to get the goods on a munitions supplier and the rumours of war in Europe.
Madcap couple George and Marion Kerby are killed in an automobile accident. They return as ghosts to try and liven up the regimented lifestyle of their friend and bank president, Cosmo Topper.
This short presents the possibility that a dead person's spirit can intervene in the lives of the living.
A satirical visualization of strange and forgotten, but (at that time) nevertheless still existing laws in the U.S.A.
Two young people meet at a wedding and begin dating, each thinking the other is extremely wealthy.

An orphaned girl is being raised in the Limberlost by her aunt, who hates her because the girl's mother married the man that the aunt loved. The girl's existence is close to being servitude bondage, and her only companions are the birds and the animals of the forest.
Edith Ellis, a good but poor girl, is involved in a wreck where her rich boyfriend's parents demand that he stays away from her.
A popular high school valedictorian and star athlete becomes a pariah when it's discovered that his father is a former bootlegger.
A happily married woman lets her catty friends talk her into divorce when her husband strays.
He reads about a search for the American heirs of Joshua Higgins, the Earl of Puddlestone, and then pays English conman Tittington to state that Joe Higgins is the heir
Marital comedy in which a department store mannequin is mistaken for
A government agent goes undercover in order to apprehend a saboteur who caused a plane crash.
An unsophisticated farm girl enrolls in college and stars in the campus musical.
On the day that United Broadcasting System's new building is dedicated, bumbling vice-president Harold L. Montgomery, Sr. discovers that he gave the wrong survey to the builders.
A musician's ex-wife wants him back after he finds love and success.
Fast-talking con-man and grifter Candy Johnson rises to be the corrupt boss of Yellow Creek, but his wife's alcoholic father tries to set things right.
Frank Faylen and Charlie Hall (a longtime Laurel & Hardy foil) star as Dolan and Doolittle, a pair of goofy druggists who join the army to escape the wrath of bill collector Mulligan
A young boxer finds his life turned upside down when he meets with sudden success in the ring.
The Weaver Brothers and Elviry have migrated from their usual hard-scrabble digs in the Ozarks and have taken up truck-farming.
The Devil works with Adolf Hitler to cause inflation in the United States.
Freckles Winslow comes home from college and the sheriff accuses him of murder, gangsters put him on the spot, and his girl friend, Jane, falls in love with a confidence man.
Jerry makes another attempt at warning Florence, but she rebuffs him. Later, the Randalls go out of town overnight, leaving Bert and Alf to watch over the house.

Harry is a workaholic piano tuner whose bride-to-be's brother threatens to kill him if he doesn't marry his sister. His latest job assignment involves a socialite and a pesky French maid hounding him constantly.
Buck Roberts is leading a wagon train of railroad supplies and Jim Corkle
Starstruck Indiana small-town girl Lily is pestering theatrical producer John Thornway for a role but he is reluctant.
A fired teacher finds work at a girls reform school and helps a detective on a case.
A dancer in a girlie show plots revenge when a judge orders her show closed.
Robert is found beside the highway with a head injury and amnesia.
A down-on-his luck actor teams up with a singing barber to do a vaudeville act. Its success eventually leads them to Broadway, but things start to go awry.
Stagecoach robbers take the money Hoppy was going to use to buy cattle so Hoppy, California and Lin go after them.
Much to the despair of her husband John, wealthy New York socialite Margaret Morgan hires former criminals to be her house servants.
To solve the murder of a man shot in a locked room, Chan must wade through a Fun House, the writings of an unscrupulous author, and chess pieces.
Movie_Name: Charlie Chan in The Chinese Cat

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A nightclub dancer, raised in an orphanage, learns she might be the long-lost heiress to a hair tonic fortune.
Docks of New York, released in 1945, follows the East Side Kids as they are pursued by criminals intent on recovering a stolen necklace.
When two bumbling barbers act as agents for a talented but unknown singer, they stage a phony murder in order to get him a plum role.
Movie_Name: Bud Abbott and Lou Costello in Hollywood

Brief_Description_of_Movie: After a demonstration of new PT boats, navy brass are still unconvinced of their viability in combat, leaving Lt. "Rusty" Ryan frustrated.
As a rough-hewn merchant marine, Gable reprises his most popular film persona, the wisecracking man’s man who loves ’em and leaves ’em – until the right dame …
Two women private detectives arrive at a dude ranch in time to investigate the murder of their client's philandering husband.
A married woman and a drifter fall in love and then plot to murder her husband.
After losing heavyweight contender Al Costa to mob boss Florini fight promoter Knobby Walsh recruits small town boy Joe Palooka to take his place.
After a rapid engagement, a dowdy daughter of a chemist weds an industrialist, knowing little of his family or past.
A grandson of a recently deceased millionaire mistakes a beautiful female disc jockey for her aunt, who once dated the grandfather.
Walter Mitty, a daydreaming writer with an overprotective mother, likes to imagine that he is a hero who experiences fantastic adventures.
Movie_Name: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Maggi continues her forever-ever efforts to crash Manhattan's top society, while Jiggs still mingles with his old construction cronies at the bar of Dinty Moore on 10th Avenue.
At his friend Hank Davenport's antique store, Nick Julian reads about a jewel-encrusted ivory statue of the Madonna and its owner, Joseph Salinas, who lives in nearby Madera, California.
A pianist about to flee from a duel receives a letter from a woman he cannot remember.
A man listens to his wife and fakes his own death so that she can get her hands on his insurance policy.
Capt. Jeremy Bradford has a particularly exciting luxury liner cruise in store when he's charged with transporting a troupe of opera singers to Rio de Janeiro.
A producer takes over a small film studio and - sensing that it'll be a good movie- begins investigating an old murder of a silent film director shot in his office years ago.
Three teenagers with troubled families are unable to adjust at home and in high-school.
A snobbish phonetics professor agrees to a wager that he can take a flower girl and make her presentable in high society.

Gerrit Ammidon, despairing of any chance to marry his love, Nettie Vollar, because of a bitter feud between his father and her grandfather, sails to China to "get away from it all". While in Shanghai he rescues a beautiful young woman being attacked by a gang of street toughs.

Bill Peck is discharged from an army hospital and goes in search of a job. Cappy Ricks hires Bill, but gives him an seemingly impossible test of finding and buying a particular blue vase to prove he can handle a challenging job in China.
Follows three generations of the Mayne family through the year 1921-22.
David Rossi is an orphan in Rome, and is taken care of by a homeless man, Bruno. The wealthy Dr. Roselli adopts David and raises him with his daughter, Roma.
Peter Pan enters the nursery of the Darling children and, with the help of fairy dust, leads them off to Never Never Land, where they meet the nefarious Captain Hook.
The teenage daughter of a wealthy couple is horrified to find out that her parents, who spend most of their time fighting with each other, are planning to divorce.

Against the backdrop of New York City of the early 1850s, a young woman -- naively seeking to win the love she reads about in the romance novels she devours -- finds one prospect in an earnest denizen of the Bowery, and another in an elegant young aristocrat.
A story of greed and lust driven by gold fever. Rapacious Kate Kent abandons her daughter Betty to run off with Tom Romaine, her husband’s killer during the Gold Rush.
An adaption of a novel by Peter Pan author J.M. Barrie.
Erstwhile childhood friends, Judah Ben-Hur and Messala meet again as adults, this time with Roman officer Messala as conqueror and Judah as a wealthy, though conquered, Israelite.
Movie_Name: Ben-Hur: A Tale of the Christ

Brief_Description_of_Movie: The plot centers Sally (Betty Bronson), a seamstress for a fashionable modiste, supports a crippled father (Theodore Roberts) and adores her kitten, Tommy.
Stunt pilot Tony marries Chrissie and the two are given a tropical island wedding by natives who consider them the King and Queen of their island.

Doris Poole, whose parents were theatrical people, was orphaned as a child, and four members of the troupe adopted and raised her. When grown, she has become the leading lady in a San Francisco stock-company.
Steve Porter, a young American bachelor and fully intending to remain as such, inherits a fortune but must get married in order to claim it.

Hired ranch hand Tex Smith is smitten with Lucy Blake, who lives in the cattle settlement of Marco. Meanwhile, Indian chief Brave Bear despises the encroachment of white people and conspires with Sam Hardman to steal the town's cattle during a rodeo.
Zac Harrison (Monte Blue), upon his release from prison assumes responsibility for seeing to the needs of June Curry (Betty Bronson), the 17-year-old daughter
After years of hopeful struggle, waiter and aspiring singer-songwriter Al Stone is on his way.
Sally Williams (Betty Bronson) marries Donald Moore (Richard Walling) and have trials and tribulations and input from others but they demonstrate that the most successful marriages
The Bellamy Trial is a 1929 American drama film directed by Monta Bell and written by Monta Bell and Joseph Farnham.
When his ne'er-do-well brother embezzles the commissary funds of their cavalry unit stationed in the Sudan, a British soldier takes the blame for him.
Sonny Boy's parents are in the midst of a bitter divorce when the boy's mother talks her sister into kidnapping him because she is terrified that her husband will take the boy out of the country
On her first anniversary, Ann Reagan finds that her sister-in-law is involved with a shady character that she used to be intimate with, and determines to intervene.
The son and daughter of an abusive shopkeeper turn to a medicine show salesman for help.
A cub reporter rashly makes a promise to solve a murder mystery within 24 hours, then must make good on his boast.
The old west range war story transported to Georgia, with Autry as the hero.

A widower and aeronautical engineer named Steven Douglas raises three sons with the help of his father-in-law, and later the boys' great-uncle. An adopted son, a stepdaughter, wives, and another generation of sons join the loving family in later seasons.

The story of a young intern in a large metropolitan hospital trying to learn his profession, deal with the problems of his patients, and win the respect of the senior doctor in his specialty, internal medicine.
A New York gangster and his girlfriend attempt to turn street beggar Apple Annie into a society lady when the peddler learns her daughter is marrying royalty.
Grindl undertakes various temporary jobs, from babysitting to ticket sales, finding creative solutions through her eccentric approach.
A former prostitute works to create a new life for herself in a small town, but a shocking discovery could threaten everything.
Run for Your Life is an American television drama series starring Ben Gazzara as a man with only a short time to live. It ran on NBC from 1965 to 1968.
Track coach Steve Walker accidentally invokes the spirit of notorious pirate Captain Blackbeard who was believed dead.
Huckleberry Finn, a rambuctious boy adventurer chafing under the bonds of civilization, escapes his humdrum world and his selfish, plotting father by sailing a raft down the Mississippi River.

Sedgewick Blynn is determined to marry a rich woman. One night he saves a child from a fire. Bessie Morgan, an heiress charmed by his act of heroism, promises to marry him, but at the last minute her father forbids it.
A tramp cares for a boy after he's abandoned as a newborn by his mother. Later the mother has a change of heart and aches to be reunited with her son.
Helen, wrongly suspected of murder, escapes to the refuge of Jim's Ranch, where love soon blooms.
A story of two rival suitors, a girl, and a father who is out for the better man. Plot summary · Add synopsis. Genres.

A series of four 2-reelers based on the stories of George Bronson Howard, directed by Duke Worne, and starring Roy Stewart in the title role; each episode in the series was a story complete in itself.
Movie_Name: The Further Adventures of Yorke Norroy

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Although he graduated from that time-worn university, the college of hard knocks, the tireless efforts of John P. Grout have paid off. He owns a number of department stores and his wife and children are well provided for.

Wyoming cattleman Laramie Lad takes a vacation by visiting an old friend who runs a summer resort, but before he can relax, he meets Jane Sheridan and her father, Al Sheridan, who are fighting off a group of swindlers who want the old man's mining property.

Oliver's mother, a penniless outcast, died giving birth to him. As a young boy Oliver is brought up in a workhouse, later apprenticed to an uncaring undertaker, and eventually is taken in by a gang of thieves who befriend him for their own purposes.
While traveling in Europe Philip Quentin encounters his former sweetheart, Dorothy Garrison, and finds that she is now engaged to Prince Ugo Ravorelli
In order to save his family from financial ruin, an English aristocrat agrees to come to America and marry the daughter of a wealthy businessman.
Blinky, the bespectacled son of Col. "Raw Meat" Islip, is scorned by his fellow cavalrymen stationed on the Mexican border because his previous military experience was as a Boy Scout.
A comedy short starring Slim Summerville and Bobby Dunn featuring an early appearance by Esther Ralston.
A tough policeman who patrols the city's worst beat loses his nerve when he believes he has hurt the girl he loves.
An unhappily married couple moves to Vienna, where the wife’s married best friend lives, and soon, sparks fly between the wife and the best friend’s husband.
Rose Hillyer, the sweetheart of cowboy Tod Walton, is about to marry Edward Gordon a slick con-man and a bigamist.
Homesick for America, Jack and his pals get aboard a ship U. S.-bound disguised as entertainers. As entertainers they're flops, but evoke considerable mirth among the passengers by their efforts.
Serialized adventures of fur trappers in the Pacific Northwest, as they fight Indians, the elements and each other.
Banker Holman knowing the deed must be registered the next day, offers a $50,000 reward for Tex's capture.
Peter Pan enters the nursery of the Darling children and, with the help of fairy dust, leads them off to Never Never Land, where they meet the nefarious Captain Hook.
Madame Vervier, a sophisticated woman, sends her daughter Alix to live with Owen Bradley's parents in London.
Beggar on Horseback is a 1924 play by George S. Kaufman and Marc Connelly. The play is a parody of the expressionistic parables that were popular at the time.
The Lucky Devil, like all successful luck comedies (yes, it is a small sub-genre but it exists), establishes a set of rules and sticks to them.
The particular wife in this story is Grace Hyatt, and her husband William is the owner of an exclusive bootery, a high-sounding name for a shoe-shop.

Bertie and Marian Lenox are children of a wealthy family, and their mother intends that they marry "within their class". They, however, have different plans--Bertie is in love with chorus girl Sally O'Neil and Marian loves Henry Morgan, the family chauffeur.
In London during World War One, a simple-minded slavey awaits her Fairy Godmother and her Prince Charming.
A New York City playboy can resist the flaming flapper and red-hot mamas along the Great White Way, so he decides to head out west to his uncle's ranch.
Mary Gray, whose father manufactures cold cream, is engaged to sappy Horace Niles, the son of Hugo Niles, the elder Gray's most competitive rival in the cosmetics business.
Even though Big Bill Devens is a powerful politician, he still sticks to his working man's roots. His wife walked out on him 20 years before and his daughter, Moira, believes she is dead.
Elmer Stone, quarterback of the 1899 Colton College football team vows to remain a student until Colton beats its biggest rival, State University.

An embellished account of the 1803 expedition by famed frigate U.S.S. Constitution--a.k.a. "Old Ironsides"--against the Barbary pirates then terrorizing American shipping, focusing on the crew and passengers of a fictional merchant ship, The Esther, who fall afoul of the same pirates and thus become involved with the Constitution's mission.
Celeste de Givray is renowned throughout Europe as the most beautiful and best-dressed model in all Paris.
A young flapper tricks her childhood sweetheart into marrying her.
A chorus girl falls in love with a budding composer.
The main story concerns wise-guy insurance salesman Richard Arlen, who through a combination of hard work and sheer gall lands a job as sales manager.
Lizzie Stokes, an obscure and colorless actress, is elevated to stardom through publicity and better coaching from Daniel Hoffman, a theatrical producer.
In love with political candidate Anthony Cowles, heroine Nancy Blair gets wind of the opposition's scheme to ruin Cowles' reputation.

Patience Winslow is an impulsive heiress who marries a much-older man whom she really doesn't love. While honeymooning on her yacht without her new husband, Patience is marooned on a desert island with handsome Captain Edmunds.
The story of a show girl in a crooked carnival attraction who becomes the enthusiastic aide of an elderly evangelist.
A naive peasant girl from Hungary has a child by a corrupt young cavalry officer, and goes to work in his house as a servant, hiding the truth.
Swiss peasant girl Vroni (Esther Ralston) is having a secret summer romance with Viennese artist Andre Frey (Gary Cooper).
A young British officer prevents a young woman from drowning herself in the Thames, but she disappears before he learns her identity.
A gangster's henchman becomes a hero after he is drafted to serve in the Great War.
A highly respectable lawyer becomes a sexual animal after working hours; His live-in mother-in-law tries to keep him in line. When an actor-impersonator comes to see him, the two switch lives.
An aspiring singer, who has fallen on hard times and is now living as a hobo, returns to his wealthy southern family.
The theft of a valuable Van Dyck painting leads to murder, and many suspects are on a plush express train speeding from Paris to Rome.
The wife of a diplomat in Geneva pretends to be a maid in order to continue her flirting with a handsome young courier.
Black Beauty is being trained to run in the steeplechase race, upon which the Cameron family has staked its fortune.
In Kentucky just after the Civil War, the Hayden-Colby feud leads to Jed Colby being sent to prison for 15 years for murder.
A beautiful woman mistakes a Prince's butler for the Prince.
I kept imagining myself in a theater in 1934 watching this gem flickering in the dark.
The publisher of a tabloid-type romance magazine decides to get some publicity by sponsoring a "Cinderella and Prince Charming" contest.
Expelled from his lieutenancy in the Marine Corps, Bill Traylor reenlists as a private. His unit is sent to a Latin American country where a rebel leader called The Torch promotes insurrection.
When a young man marries a Russian girl, he finds that he has married her entire family.
A reckless black-balled investigator who is given a police escort out of most towns, is hired by the owner of a casino to investigate the murder of a young man.
Newsreels form the backdrop of this story of the romance between a company owner's daughter and a rival's cameraman.
An immigration agent (Regis Toomey) and a judge's daughter (Esther Ralston) bust smugglers flying Chinese into the country.
A ham-handed cautionary fable against communism, the film concerns a group of Civil War veterans who are appalled by the burgeoning radical movement.
An actress (Evelyn Venable), an eloper (Esther Ralston), a producer (Victor Jory) and a drunk liven up a coast-to-coast train.
A jetliner is forced to land in a remote region of Arizona under suspicious circumstances.
John Foster (Conrad Nagel) and Kenneth Grainger (Donald Cook) are a couple of Englishmen stationed at a teak wood post.
An expose of scandal-and-gossip magazines of the era, has-been actor John Blakeford agrees to write his memoirs for magazine-publisher Jordan Winston.
The Chamber of Commerce brings together the Dionne quintuplets and other people Dr. John Luke delivered. He hands out wisdom and advice to all.
Two petty gangsters trying to elude their enemies join the French Foreign Legion.
When a boss proposes marriage to his secretary, she discovers that the arrangement is solely for tax purposes.
Mystery and adventure, surrounding a stolen rubber harvest.
Jim Dorn endeavors to protect Jean McNain from a man she knows has committed a murder, Carter Snowden
Two American-army officers are working on a new type of machine-gun for anti-aircraft warfare, when one of them is murdered.
An aging actor, trying to make a comeback on Broadway, is surprised when his estranged daughter shows up. It seems that she is an actress and is also trying to make it on Broadway.
Owner of salon catering to fat society dames must deal with a dull fiance, a romantic stranger, the jealous blond who loves him, and the lecherous husband ...

Songwriters Calhoun and Harrigan get Katie and Lily Blane to introduce a new one. Lily goes to England, and Katy joins her after the boys give a new song to Nora Bayes. All are reunited when the boys, now in the army, show up in England.
Longshoreman Johnny Barnes is in love with Kitty Tracy, barmaid at her father's waterfront saloon, and he beats up Cassidy, a crooked politician who has been annoying her.
Re-edited feature film version of the 1937 serial, Jungle Menace.
An ambitious, headstrong businessman uses his huge personal fortune to construct a spaceship that will take him to Mars.

The show starred former silent film icon Esther Ralston, whose career had faded with the advent of sound in the late 1920s; she had lost most of her money and had been working as a sales clerk before finding some acting roles here and there.
A documentary exploring the origins of the pioneers of women directors during the silent era.
Movie_Name: The Silent Feminists: America's First Women Directors

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A thrill-seeking socialite named Diana Mallory is engaged to marry a bland, very proper Englishman named Roderick Keswick. Keswick wants to purge Diana of her thrill-seeking ways, so he arranges for her to spend a night in a haunted house in order to frighten the audacity out of her. Unbeknownst to Keswick, the old mansion is being used as a hideout for an Oriental criminal mastermind named Chang-Tzo, and Diana winds up having the adventure of her life. The house sports some weird characters, one of which is referred to in the film as "The Thing".
Franti, an organ grinder of the poor districts of New York, has a daughter, Isola, who sings to his street piano's accompaniment.

Actress Jane Carleson has three admirers: Henry Strong (a millionaire), Hamilton Ross (a chemist), and Murray Campbell (a district attorney). When Jane weds Campbell, Ross writes an anonymous letter to Campbell, warning him that Strong is after his wife.
When Count Peter Turgeneff, his daughter Nadia, and his generous-hearted son Paul came to live in the Governor's palace in the Russian province of Valogda, ...

Helena Richie leaves her drunken husband, who had killed their child, and goes to Old Chester in Pennsylvania with her friend Lloyd Pryor. Helena adopts a homeless boy, David, who had been a ward of the town's minister, Dr. Lavendar.
A young woman swears revenge on the man who left her father destitute in the Alaska gold fields.
Faro Black, the chief of the Gypsies, finds out that his son Faro and his girlfriend Egypt have gotten married.

Miriam Monroe and John Conrad are two young scientific workers who, independently of each other, have discovered a chemical called exonite. Miriam discovered it while searching for a cure for cancer, while Conrad used it as a basis for a powerful explosive.
Overcome with guilt after having an affair with her best friends husband, Clorinda hopes to escape her past by moving to Europe, where she meets Malcolm, a decent man who falls in love with her.

Ethel Barrymore plays the wife of an abusive country squire. So nasty is her husband that he all but forces her to seek solace in the arms of her former sweetheart (played by Alan Hale in his leading-man period).
Maris, having married Lynch, a worthless man who deserts her, taking their daughter Felice with him, marries mill owner Dwight Alden after receiving notification that her husband and child are dead.

The National Red Cross Pageant (1917) was an American war pageant that was performed in order to sell war bonds, support the National Red Cross, and promote a positive opinion about American involvement in World War I.
Wealthy American widow Elizabeth Carter plans to marry the Earl of Dettminster when lawyer Augustus Tucker informs her of a codicil in her late husband's will.
Mrs. Emma McChesney is a determined and successful traveling saleswoman for T. A. Buck's Featherbloom Petticoat Company.
Based on the 1907 play 'Lady Frederick' by W. Somerset Maugham, this tells the story of Betsy O'Hara in her pursuit of romance and love.
A home movie version of the Dumas play. A young woman becomes a courtesan and tragedy befalls her.
Movie_Name: Camille: The Fate of a Coquette

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A prince plots to kill the mad monk Rasputin for the good of the czar, the czarina and Russia.
A multi-studio effort to show the newsreel audience the progress of the Hollywood war effort.
When an itinerant reluctantly returns home to help his sickly mother run her shop, they're both tempted to turn to crime to help make ends meet.
On a stormy night, the mute servant to an ailing matriarch is stalked by a serial killer.
Young Swedish-American Katrin "Katie" Holstrom (Loretta Young) leaves her family farm in Minnesota, headed for nursing school.
Set in turn-of-the-century London, a woman trying to solve the mystery of a friend's murder finds that she may be the next victim.
Attorney Anthony Keane (Gregory Peck) agrees to represent Londonite Mrs. Paradine (Alida Valli), who has been fingered in her husband's murder.
A socialite pretends to be poor and blind in her plan to help a blinded pianist.
Stigmatized from infancy by the fate of his criminal father, a man is bruised and bullied until one night, in a fit of rage, he kills his most persistent tormentor.
A mysterious girl inspires a struggling artist.
A young man succumbs to gambling fever.
In Philadelphia, the soprano Prudence Budell returns from Europe after a period of five years training in the best Europeans music schools.

Pinky, a light skinned black woman, returns to her grandmother's house in the South after graduating from a Northern nursing school. Pinky tells her grandmother that she has been "passing" for white while at school in the North.
A Russian ballerina in Vienna tries to flee KGB agents and defect.
Four panelists must determine guests' occupations - and, in the case of famous guests, while blindfolded, their identity - by asking only "yes" or "no" questions.
Architecture of an 11th century church on the site of a temple of Apollo near Athens.
Movie_Name: Daphni: Virgin of the Golden Laurels

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A con artist and his criminal cohorts hold an old lady hostage in her own home.

After a group of convicts escapes from prison, they take refuge in the wilderness. While most of the crew are ruthless sociopaths, Jim Canfield is an innocent man who was jailed under false pretenses.

Comprised of eight unrelated episodes of inconsistent quality, this anthology piece of American propaganda features some of MGM Studios' best directors, screenwriters and actors; it is narrated by Louis Calhern.
With three days before his paper folds, a crusading editor tries to expose a vicious gangster.
Jordan Blake (a widower) is a successful Broadway Producer who has always been to busy for his children, Barbara and Jerry.
It was hosted by Alistair Cooke (his first show in the US) and it featured a broad range of programming about science, the arts and the humanities.
A black man is maligned by his military peers. They play jokes on him to see his reaction; and he soon becomes "The Patsy" for their abusive entertainment.
Passengers on an ocean liner recall their greatest loves.

In New York, a surly, down-on-his-heels playwright meets a country girl who's giving up trying to act and returning home. He goes with her for inspiration when his agent convinces a stage star to take his next effort.
A young major league baseball player, Jimmy Piersall (Tab Hunter), battles mental illness and a harsh upbringing to succeed as a Boston Red Sox outfielder.
The life of the youngest of three sisters in a musical family is complicated by the separate arrivals of a charming composer and a cynical music arranger.
A down-and-out vaudeville comedian, Buddy McCoy, becomes a successful silent movie star, but experiences tragedy in his personal life.
It's not so much that Eloise is a mischievous child, but the darnedest things do happen when she's around.
Sentimental tale of an elderly woman awaiting a reunion with her long-lost "bad" son.
A young couple conducts a series of robberies, followed by a chase, in which they are shot and killed. Where to Watch The Automobile Thieves.
Daniel Boone is captured by Indians when he tries to rescue his abducted daughter.
At a boarding house, Florence Lawrence is trimming a hat while a couple of the male tenants clumsily try to flirt with her.
Movie_Name: The Boy, the Bust and the Bath

Brief_Description_of_Movie: An early short featuring Florence Lawrence.
A woman replaces her injured beau on a spy mission.
Movie_Name: The Despatch Bearer; or, Through the Enemy's Lines

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Macbeth usurps the Scottish throne by murdering his predecessor.
Two feuding houses are united with the marriage and eventual death of their children.
Movie_Name: Romeo and Juliet (A Romantic Story of the Ancient Feud Between the Italian Houses of Montague and Capulet)

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A Seventeenth Century romance in which an eloping couple try to escape the wrath of the girl's father.
Movie_Name: Lady Jane’s Flight, a 17th Century Romance

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A Saxon prisoner rescues his Viking's captor's daughter, resulting in his freedom and their marriage.
Movie_Name: The Viking's Daughter: The Story of the Ancient Norsemen

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A gang of lawless freebooters who terrorized the country and made travel in the mountains a hazardous pastime hold up a stylish landau in which are seated an old gentleman, a duenna, and a pretty young Senora.
Movie_Name: The Bandit’s Waterloo (The Outwitting of an Andalusian Brigand by a Pretty Senora)

Brief_Description_of_Movie: King Herod is enchanted by Salome's dance and grants her wish for the head of John the Baptist.
Mrs. Wharton, a dashing widow, gives a party at her beautiful villa in honor of the presentation to her of a handsome diamond necklace by her fiancé.
Mack Sennett appears as a Native American in this film produced by the Biograph Company.
A mother works as a dancer to support her ill daughter. One night while performing, the mother has a vision of her child dying. She rushes home, but it is too late.
Movie_Name: Behind the Scenes: Where All Is Not Gold That Glitters

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Mack Sennett appears as a man in the bar in this film produced by the Biograph Company.
Pretty Miss Chrysanthemum has but little to say as to the disposal of her heart, at least, such is the custom in Japan. Her parents attend to that for her.
An early Biograph short in which two separate sequences of events collide and the leading man must save his lady from the villain.
After his wife receives an extravagant dress, a man find himself the victim of an attempted burglary; He hides in his fireplace, which is then fired.
Vitagraph production of Shakespeare's Richard III.
It would have taken more than the wonderful powers of deduction of a Sherlock Holmes to have dispelled the mystery that shrouded the disappearance of a case of jewels at the home of Robert Jenkins.
Mack Sennett appears as a waiter in this film produced by the Biograph Company.
A mother and her young daughter are abducted by the Zulus who killed the woman's husband, but their recently bereaved Chief takes pity on them.
An elderly gentleman gets snubbed by his family members when he wants to go out. He decides to get a make-over, which leads to dramatic consequences.
Mack Sennett appears as a barbarian in this film produced by the Biograph Company.
Mack Sennett appears as a man in the bar and in the wedding party in this film produced by the Biograph Company.
A young wife and mother grows tired of the farm life so she leaves her husband and child behind to find something better.

This early D.W. Griffith short shows the director's interest in Jewish ghetto life, portrayed here with sympathy and sentimentality. The melodramatic plot involves the conflict between generations in an immigrant Jewish family.
George Redfeather, the hero of this subject, returns from Carlisle, where he not only graduated with high honors, but was also the star of the college football team.
Mack Sennett appears as a policeman and waiter in this film produced by the Biograph Company.
A castaway returns home after years lost at sea, to the wife and child he left behind. Has she waited faithfully or has she moved on?
A remarkable love story of the noblest Roman and the most beautiful Egyptian. A stupendous production of Shakespeare's Masterpiece.
Movie_Name: Antony and Cleopatra, a Love Story of the Noblest Roman and the Most Beautiful Egyptian

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Young Wilkinson is leaving his dear old mother for a journey to seek his fortune in a foreign clime. Now, the little cottage is situated near the coast.
Based on Shakespeare's play. Petruchio courts the bad-tempered Katharina, and tries to change her aggressive behavior.
While battling with poverty and the declining health of a relative, a young woman struggles to find employment.
A hunter lost in the Northern woods is rescued by a trapper and his wife. He makes advances to the wife, is rejected, and tries to kill the trapper.
The pretty daughter of a French-Canadian backwoodsman incites the love of a trapper who is so smitten with the beauty of this wood nymph that he purchases her into marriage from her father.
Mack Sennett appears as a dinner guest and a policeman in this film produced by the Biograph Company.
Bachelor Reggie writes his uncle that he has a wife and child, but then must produce them when the uncle visits.
Biographical drama, adaptation of Shakespeare's play.

An old miser steals a purse dropped by a passing girl. Finding a generous roll of notes inside, he goes to the bank to have them exchanged for gold coins. A couple of thugs witness the transaction and are at once infected by the money fever.

Nellie flees her old life and goes east to become a nurse, where she marries a doctor. One of her old colleagues finds her and tries to blackmail her. When the blackmail plot is exposed, Nellie's husband expresses his complete faith in her.

A bored Lady Helen goes slumming as a domestic in a boarding house. There she falls in love with a sensitive young musician. The other women in the house are jealous, and accuse her of trying to steal the musician's violin.
Sight unseen, a man buys a bag that turns out to contain burglar tools. He can't get rid of the bag, even when he's robbed. The thieves assume he's a colleague and return the bag and tools.
Harry's jealous former mistress puts poison in some candy intended for his new fiancée. Harry discovers what she has done, and races to save his fiancée before she eats the candy.
Gertrude chooses Jim over Jack, which makes Jack very jealous. Later Jim dies, and Jack marries Gertrude. He finds himself once again very jealous of the late Lucky Jim.
Out-of-work, Tim steals a sandwich, then knocks out the policeman who chases him. He changes into the policeman's uniform, and is approached by a wife who needs help with her drunken husband.
Movie_Name: Tis an Ill Wind That Blows No Good

Brief_Description_of_Movie: A shoe-factory worker puts a note in a shoe box offering to marry the lucky buyer. As a result, she is dismissed from her job, but her employer finds her so attractive that he suggests a new job for her, as his wife.
After overhearing Jones mocking her, the lady book agent slips a suggestive note into Jones's pocket. A jealous Mrs. Jones finds the note, and a huge quarrel erupts.
Movie_Name: Jones and the Lady Book Agent

Brief_Description_of_Movie: The story tells of the young widowed mother of two children who is forced by extreme poverty to part with one of her children, a baby girl, by placing it in a basket on the door steps of a wealthy banker.
John is seduced and abandoned by a cruel flirt. Later he learns that his friend Frank is engaged to the same woman. He relates his story to Frank and convinces him to jilt her at the altar.

Nekhludoff, a Russian nobleman serving on a jury, discovers that the young girl on trial, Katusha, is someone he once seduced and abandoned and that he himself bears responsibility for reducing her to crime.
A dying man sends a note to his lost love asking her to visit him, but she brings along some drunken party guests. They find him dead, and she repents her lightheartedness.
A girl is being shipped off to Europe with her aunt to break up her romance. Her suitor dresses himself as the aunt and manages to fool everyone long enough for them to elope.
A young couple must endure a tedious visit from their aunt until their friend offers to find a way to make her leave.
A family struggles with a man's excessive consumption of alcohol.
A new bride makes a batch of biscuits. Her husband pretends to like them, so she delivers the rest to his office; but one bite of these biscuits makes a person violently ill.
When Mrs. Jones returns with her new, very large "peach basket" hat, the maid hides the gypsy family behind a curtain.
A women is scarred in an accident,but won't stand in the way of her lover marrying another.
A young woman struggles to replace a borrowed necklace stolen from her at a social event.
A doctor is called away to the sickbed of a neighbor.
House painter Jim Brooks thinks his wife is cheating on him with his best friend John West. The intrigue is in fact a birthday surprise.

A royal woman rejects her arranged marriage. The cardinal hatches a plan: the suitor will shave and change clothes. He arranges with four clowns to stage an attack on the princess which he easily repels.
Alice misunderstands when she sees her sweetheart Frank accidentally kissing her sister, and gets upset.
A Greek woman marries a struggling sculptor. When he can't support her and their baby, she offers to sell herself as a slave to allow them to buy food.
In an Indian tribe, a girl escapes from her father and suitor to be with the man she loves.
Mr. Jones stays out late playing poker with his buddies. While he's gone, a burglar starts to break into his home. Mr. Jones arrives home just in time to catch him.
Mr. Jones jumps to the wrong conclusions when he sees a bouquet of flowers and a man's hat in the parlor.
Movie_Name: Mrs. Jones' Lover or, I Want My Hat

Brief_Description_of_Movie: During the American Revolution, a young soldier carrying a crucial message to General Washington is spotted and pursued by a group of enemy soldiers.
A short romance starring Florence Lawrence.
During the French Revolution, a wealthy couple lives safely by professing republican beliefs.
The forest ranger's daughter catches a spouse by hoodwinking Papa who brings in a minister.
A wife innocently inspires suspicion by generously giving away some money given to her for a hat.
A rich little girl helps a poor little girl by making their Christmas enjoyable.
The protagonists of the film are Florence Lawrence (wife of the director) and King Baggot , a well-known theatrical actor, here in his cinematographic debut.
A girl's affections waver between the winner of a boxing match, and a greedy count.
Two girls fall for the same boy.
The indolent, thriftless black sheep of the family, the good-for-nothing son of a rich banker bothers his busy brother, who is disgusted with the antics of his drunken sibling.
An abused wife takes a shot at her husband, and, as a result, he reforms.
Five days more! Only five more days says the physician, and the man who has for so long a time been totally blind will be able to take off the bandage, and have the great, light world before him!
Jane thinks she has witnessed a murder and the suspect is arrested; she later learns the truth and saves him from hanging.

An honest man trades places with a convict so the convict can see his dying wife, but he is killed on his way back to prison. The governor must step in to assure the right man is released from prison.
A mother loses her sanity when she loses her child. Her husband brings home a newly adopted child, and she regains her health.
A girl saves her sweetheart from the dealings of a deceitful gang that he has fallen in with.
A clever girl inventively uses a stage prop to attract help when burglars enter her house.
After an accident, a young girl desperately needs a blood transfusion to save her life. A young blacksmith agrees to be the donor and wins her heart as well.
A young woman pulls a fast switch on the fiance handpicked by her father.
A dramatic love triangle between two women and a man.

A pretty model with two rival art students (her father's pupils) in love with her, a situation not at all surprising considering how alluring she looks in the garb of a nun, posing for their canvas. Jealousy and anger ensues.
A young woman marries a man she hardly knows or understands; in a moment of crisis, the two suddenly realize what they mean to each other.
A husband becomes jealous when he finds his wife's shawl in a suspicious location.
An orphaned girl raised by a miner in the wilderness falls in love with a tenderfoot, even though the miner loves her as well.
A young doctor is jealous of one of his patient's romantic interest in his nurse.

A young wife instigates a duel between a dashing count, with whom she has been having an affair, and her elderly husband. In the duel, the husband is mortally wounded and his now repentant wife chooses to join him in death.
A philandering husband arranges an ill-planned rendezvous at the same restaurant his wife and daughter are dining at.
A couple goes to Reno to be divorced, but change their minds at the last moment.
A wife tries to drive away her husband's best friend by flirting with him, but trouble arises when the friend flirts back.
A circus girl must decide to stay under the big top or marry the minister who loves her.
Two old gentlemen who have been pals from boyhood decide that their children ought to marry.
A husband learns from his mistake after he wrongly accuses his wife of infidelity.
When an infirm husband learns of the dire circumstances his wife must endure, he makes every effort to bring himself back to health.
A rejected suitor rebuffs the woman he loves after the death of her husband.
A woman is forced to reevaluate the quiet man in her life when she finds he actually could be her knight in shining armor.
When a senator falls victim to morphine addiction, a look-alike double takes his place.
A fickle tomboy eventually falls for the suitor who had previously been annoying her.
There is always a right girl for all of us; sometime, somewhere, somehow we find her. But often the discovery leads through strange channels and peculiar by-ways.
An extravagant wife leaves her husband, but returns when he strikes it rich.
Roses and trousers have little in common and pressed roses presage something wrong in the scheme of things. When roses are pressed instead of a pair of trousers, chaos and confusion is the result
A jealous husband misinteprets the performance his actress wife is putting on with his best friend.
Gerald and Percy inherit a fortune and spend all of it in pursuit of a young heiress.
A scheming suitor ends up losing his girl to a rival even after he receives an inheritance.
A brash young man loses the business he inherits but learns a lesson in love from the daughter of his rival.
A sympathetic showgirl assumes the guilt for her cousin who is cheating on her husband.
A girl chooses between two boys by testing how each one would help the poor.
Nan feigns insanity when her former sweetheart unexpectedly appears.
A silly and extravagant wife must learn to curb her wild ways before her husband is willing to take her back.
A husband uses a ruse to sneak back into the house after a night out.
A prima donna falls in love with the voice of a singer that she hears on a recording.
A girl from the country writes glowing letters about life in the big city despite the fact that it's really been disastrous.
A mother unknowingly commits bigamy when her first husband, who was supposed to be dead, unexpectedly returns.

The Harrington's first born has died and the father and mother are inconsolable in their grief. Mrs. Harrington later seeks diversion in society, but the husband is engrossed in his work as a scientist, having a laboratory in his house.
One man squanders a fortune and loses his house and sweetheart to another who strikes it rich.
An impoverished father is forced to give up his daughter for adoption. After she is grown, she realizes she has two fathers: her real one and her "adopted" one.
A young soldier is shipped overseas after a hasty marriage; when he returns he doesn't recognize his wife who has changed from the tomboy he married to a sophisticated young woman.
A sheriff must decide whether or not to allow his old friend, a criminal, to escape.
A nurse ignores her other patients in order to concentrate on her favorite one, a fascinating bachelor.
A wayward brother is mistaken for a burglar in his own house.
A reformed woman shows a petty thief the righteous path by her good example.
A woman's sweetheart is prevented from killing himself by two burglars who are afraid they will be accused of murder if he pulls the trigger.
A kindhearted criminal saves the life of the sheriff's daughter and is allowed to make it across the state line in order to avoid jail.
Misunderstandings abound when a minister's son and an actress become engaged.
An orphaned young woman rejects her appointed suitor and falls in love with her guardian.
An heiress, a businessman, and a playboy form the eternal triangle.
The sons and daughters on the opposing sides of a Kentucky feud fall in love and dismantle their fathers' guns to prevent further bloodshed.
A Civil War spy story in which a girl and the officer she loves find themselves on opposite sides of the conflict.
A minister is talked into performing a marriage ceremony for his sister and the beau he despised.
A society woman gambles at cards.
An actress teaches a young girl how to flirt and win back her beau.
Two brothers, one a minister and the other a cad, both love the same girl.
A jealous mother is envious of the affection shown toward her future daughter-in-law by her husband.
A widow threatens her rebellious daughter that she will remarry if the girl does not behave at school.
When a young man loses his wealth, he also loses his fiancee, but he is more than consoled by her younger sister.
Two brothers vie for Rosie's hand; she gives a rose to each of them.
A local girl's romance with the lifeguard at a seaside lifesaving station is threatened by the arrival of tourists.
A young governess catches the eye of an aristocrat and romance blossoms.
A maid loves her employer, sacrificing her own happiness in order to insure his.
An escaped mental patient assumes the identity of a society girl's dead father and threatens her marriage.
Florence Lawrence stars in this society comedy in rural surroundings.
When a bored wife seeks a Reno divorce, she regains the attentions of her inattentive husband.
Aunt Jane's nieces and nephews bicker over an anticipated legacy.
A young man marries a chorus girl whom his father distrusts, and because of it is disinherited. Slowly the older and younger people are reunited.
A young woman helps her brother by purchasing a much needed piece of land.
A hastily written letter is used in a blackmail scheme by a scorned suitor.
A pianist's music annoys a painter, making him unable to work. Eventually they fall in love.
John Cummins, a wealthy society man, while out in his auto, discovers he is out of gasoline. He stops at a country store and meets Flo Page, the daughter of the proprietor.
A surgeon risks his life in order to finish surgery on a patient when a fire breaks out in the hospital.

Flo is not like the other girls at the Ferncliffe Seminary, in that she does not like the attention of the young men at the nearby college, and their efforts to win her affection prove disastrous to their ruffled spirits.
A foolish suitor gains favor in a girl's eyes when he pretends to have saved her life. When the truth is known, she rejects him for the real hero.
Two actors, trying to soak up local color for an upcoming play, fall in love with the same girl.
A matchmaking wife brings suspicion upon herself when she tries to reunite a young couple.
Flo's suitor wins her mother's favor when he returns a lost pocketbook.
A stray bullet accidentally kills a blackmailer.
Fred acts as a matchmaker for his cousin Flo and his friend George.
A country suitor's jealousy of his rival for his sweetheart's hand culminates in fisticuffs.
A spurned suitor threatens to kill Margie's sweetheart if she does not give him up.

Little Flo is the daughter of a blind musician and the pair live by means of the few pennies tossed to them on the street, the father playing the violin and Flo dancing and singing to his accompaniment.
Headmistress Flo disciplines unruly boys at her father's school. Her innovative methods include hosing the boys down and locking them inside an ice house.
Dr. Jane Bixby, a new doctor in a rural town, solves the mystery of the moonshiner's still.
Two old sweethearts, Henry Jones and Mrs. Mary Owen, he a widower and she a widow, meet at a summer resort and, renewing their old love, get married.
Betty, a farm cook, yearns to be an actress, but her dreams turn into nightmares, and she seeks comfort in the arms of a hired hand.
An unattractive girl endeavors to make herself attractive to an artist, but he sees only the artificial beauty of a model.
When a minister tries to clean up Riverton, he finds an unexpected ally in the barkeeper's daughter.
When a fireman rescues his long-lost sister-in-law he mistakes her for his wife when she dies, and contemplates suicide until he learns the truth.
An heiress, under the protection of the Queen, falls in love with a poor knight.
At the opening of the film Pennsylvania Avenue is shown, nearly blocked by a motley mob of sightseers looking at the marching Suffragettes.
The daughter of an aristocratic Southern family, proud, but impoverished, enters into a marriage of convenience with a wealthy stockbroker.
Romance develops between a young woman from the Tennessee hills and a man from the city; she saves his life when her brothers threaten to kill him; they part, eventually to be reunited years later.
An actress cures a wayward young man of his extravagant spending.
A young girl survives a dreadful childhood and grows up to right an old wrong.
A young Jewish woman wrestles with the dilemma of an interfaith marriage.
A mother, grieving over the loss of her child, finds contentment in loving a lame orphan.
A society girl changes places with her maid for an adventure.
An actress assumes a guilty appearance in order to save her faithless cousin's marriage.
A wayward girl falls in love with the handsome image of a burglar she sees in a photograph.
A woman of loose morals takes the place of a young bride.
A shopgirl assumes the guilt of her mother and is sent to prison.
A new bride tries to win the affection of her stepchild.
Two couples head for Reno to swap partners, but change their minds at the last minute.
A woman adopts the guise of a spy when she uncovers an arms plot concerning a country in Central America.
A female mail carrier is injured on her route and recovers at a bachelor's lodge.
A maid risks her life for her employer, with whom she is in love.
A woman is commanded under hypnosis to break into her father's safe.
A maid discards her beau in favor of a musician whom she idolizes; when reality sets in, she takes her old beau back.
A doctor commits perjury in order to win a woman whose husband could go to prison based on his testimony.
When placed in a position to choose between two jealous suitors, a young woman turns the tables on them by choosing a third.
A confirmed bachelor falls in love with the young woman whom he had pawned off on his aunt when she was first put into his custody.
A promotional one-reel film promoting the stars of Universal Pictures.
An uninhibited young woman is brought up by a reclusive eccentric.
A young girl falls in love with a count, despite her father's disapproval.
Two lovers disguise themselves as counterfeiters in order to escape from the girl's disapproving parents.
A moving picture actress is mistaken for an escaped asylum patient; the insane girl then steps into the actress's life.
A platonic experiment as to how a young couple should make love fails when it ceases to be platonic.
Movie_Name: The Man Who Was Never Kissed

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Based on the spy novel of the same name by Jacques Futrelle.
Florence, trying to escape fortune hunters, is residing at the seashore, when her maid dies. Florence has pretended to be the maid of this woman and she continues the deception.
A Florence Lawrence short film directed by Winthrop Kelley
Katherine Nevin and her brother Jack are given positions on the newspaper of James Osborne following their father's death.
The story revolves around a young woman named Lenore Vance (Mabel Forrest), who loses her memory after witnessing the death of her father Silas Gregg (William H Turner).

Bank clerk Vincent Forrest loses his savings in a gambling den run by Madame Zoe and her provider, Van Merton. Forrest's wife Ann begins an affair with Merton when she discovers that Forrest is infatuated with Madame Zoe.
A small textile factory down south is run by a cruel foreman that bullies and fires on whim the workers, especially the office girl who starts a day nursery for their children.
The police use a gangster's son to get to him ...
When Peaceful Patton goes to work at the Martini ranch he is mistaken for the notorious outlaw the Hard Hombre.
A farmer's widow takes on the land and her late husband's tempestuous son.
A dress model (Carole Lombard) and a mechanic (Chester Morris) each experience an empty, wealthy life before falling in love in poverty.
In the 1860s, Mary Marlowe defies her father's wishes to marry a British lord and runs away with clerk John Carlton as he heads West to make his fortune.
The Great McGonigle and his troupe of third-rate vaudevillians manage to stay one step ahead of the bill collectors and the sheriff.
Hard-working, henpecked Ambrose Ambrose Wolfinger takes off from work to go to a wrestling match with catastrophic consequences.
A prospector goes under cover to clear his name of robbery before he can lay claim to a mother lode of gold.
When a rich but cantankerous dowager on an isolated estate hires an engaging handyman, her niece/companion becomes suspicious of his motives.
The Biblical story of the shepherd boy who became King of the Israelites.
Nicotine faeries wreck havoc on a smoker.
Movie_Name: Princess Nicotine; or, The Smoke Fairy

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Drama Short
An early film adaptation of the Bard's comic fantasy-- and perhaps the first screen adaptation of a Shakespeare play.
The story begins with the finding of a wonderful peach which comes floating down a small stream and is brought to shore by a little Japanese woman, who takes it to her home.
Made by the Edison Manufacturing Company and directed by Edwin S. Porter, the film starred Gladys Hulette as Alice.
Lorna Dugal, the little daughter of an English nobleman, is carried off by her father's enemies, the Doones, when she is five years old.
In the first scene we see a group of children at a window waiting for the arrival of their father. Following this we learn that the little family lacks a mother.

Jack meets the familiar figure of the butcher who bargains with him for the cow and finally Jack consents to part with the animal for the wonderful beans which will grow up overnight until they reach the sky.
The story of this film begins with the ominous day on which Lord Bellomont gave William Kidd a commission to rid the seas of pirates.
Mr. Meekley, a baseball fan, has a flat tire on his way to a pennant game. He remains determined to make it to the game regardless of this and further setbacks.
Roy Conover has just returned to his village home from college.

Based on Browning's poem, a widowed Duchess raises a son that decides to abandon modern ways and act like it's the medieval days. When he wishes to marry, a young woman is found and plays along believing it's all a joke.

During his daily duties, Casey the Cop rescues a woman who's soon his sweetheart. Later, she learns from her banker uncle that her inheritance has been stolen, and he's accusing Casey's own cashier brother. Casey is on the case.

An optimistic girl survives city life as a shoeshine until she ends up in Children's Court. Just as she helps her geranium, Sally, to grow, a kindly judge sees her potential and takes her to his mother's country home to flourish.

To her aunt's dismay, Prudence isn't interested in society life. She'd rather listen to the butler's tall tales of being a pirate. Nixed from a boat trip, she rents a schooner, recruits a crew and raises the jolly roger.

The affluent Carnabys have now dwindled in fortune and family, leaving just Lucy and her brother, Gordon in financial straits. Situations escalate as they struggle to pay their bills and deal with Gordon's gambling debts.
Mary Flynn is raised by her foster father Sid to believe that robbing the rich is a commendable means of earning a living.
Accompanied by his daughter Esther, the aged Rev. Timothy Neal gives up the ministry and goes to the city, hoping to earn a living selling books.
Susie organizes plays to benefit the Red Cross. She marries her hero, Robert, but finds out he did it to avoid the draft. She begs to be taken in his place and is soon captured by the enemy.

Young David Kinemon is a good-natured, easy-going lad in a mountain village. Circumstances force him to take his brother's place as mail carrier for the community, and this brings him into deadly contact with the vicious Hatburn brothers.
Margherita, an Italian girl, comes to America to avenge the murder of her fiancé by the mysterious Cardi.
While visiting France, Prince Rudolph (Cody) falls in love with a peasant girl (Jane Thomas), but her parents force her to marry a man of their own choosing.
silent drama featuring Betty Blythe, Robert Frazer, and Gladys Hulette
The dashing but arrogant Prince Michael Fedor Lubimoff has to flee Tsarist Russia after falling into disgrace and settles in Monte Carlo, where he resumes ...
In a small seaside town, John Linden leaves his wife and daughter for his lover, Jessie Walton, whom he also leaves after the birth of their daughter.

Neighbour to the pre-presidential Abe Lincoln in Springfield, Illinois, young Davy Brandon accompanies his father westward to realise the elder's dream of a rail line bridging the ends of the continent.
The daughter of a wealthy man secretly marries a man below her station— one whom her father violently disapproves of.
After 15 years of searching, Bud Watkins finally has his revenge on the cattlemen's gunman who killed his homesteader foster father, Pop Watkins.
Movie_Name: The Ridin' Kid from Powder River

Brief_Description_of_Movie: Gilda is a crook who wants to go straight, but her pals keep holding her back. She moves to Hollywood to begin anew but the old gang follows behind.
The Pride of the Force s a 1925 silent crime film
Zara, a phony psychic in a Hungarian carnival who, under the guidance of a Svengali-like con man crashes — and proceeds to swindle — American high society.
In the prologue Sharon Kimm and Mickey Reid are childhood friends in a tenement neighborhood but are separated when Sharon is placed in an orphanage.
Charley Chase plays a timid bank clerk who needs $10,000 right away.
When she can't support her illegitimate child, an abandoned young woman puts her up for adoption and pursues a career as a torch singer. Years later, she searches for the child she gave up.
Wrongfully blamed for the death of Col. John Randall, Cameo Kirby (Gilbert) must find the true villain and clear his name before he can declare his love for Adele (Olmstead), the dead man's daughter.
Two reeler served as Jean Arthur's screen debut.
Dress shop owner Madame Maxine employs two chimps to serve in her establishment. It goes about as well as you would expect!
The attempt of two rivals to curry favor with the girls and their schemes and pranks to outwit each other furnish the basis of this comedy short.
Slim appears as a police court judge and Bobby as one of the jurors who is later given a job as bailiff.
Two cowboys are in love with a single lass. A hypnotist shows up one as a sheik which turns her affections to the other. Morrison as the "sheik" desires to regain her interest.
When a band of Indians, led by the renegade Deroux, attack a construction train, Davy recognizes Deroux as his father's murderer and kills him in a hand-to-hand fight.
Based on a play be Rachel Crothers, WINE OF YOUTH is a solid drama about "the modern young generation" and how they think they know it all. It's also a play about love and marriage.
Buddy rescues Bonnie Norton and is rewarded with a job on her father's ranch.
Lightning Bill Lewis sets out to capture Gómez, the leader of a ruthless gang that has been tormenting a border town.

Plot concerns happy-go-lucky rancher who decides to spruce up in order to win the affection of a girl. Enemies seeking to have him put out of the way, plan to rob a stagecoach with one man dressed in Bill's clothes.
A cowboy sets out to help a pretty young girl who is about to lose her ranch when crooks plan to foreclose on it because she doesn't have enough money to make her mortgage payment.

Evil Red Sampson and his band of rustlers shoot up Mineral Point, the ranch of William Conway, owner of a gold mine. Shot and dying, Conway reveals the location of his mine at Boulder Creek in a note.
Struggling stockbroker Jimmie Shannon learns that, if he gets married by 7 p.m. on his 27th birthday -- which is today -- he'll inherit $7 million from an eccentric relative.
Marmaduke Grandon, a clerk in a drugstore, wants to get into the movies and is given the chance when an actor dies suddenly during the shooting of a film.
"Bud Brant returns to his father's ranch to find that his father's helper, Shorty, is rustling cattle for a neighbouring rancher.
Jim Dorn, owner of the Bar X Ranch, is accused of crime he actually committed by Bud Deering, his girlfriend Ann's brother.
While romancing the millinery store owner, Custer finds himself falsely accused of murdering his boss and is soon fleeing from a vicious lynch mob.
When a bank is robbed, the cashier is killed and suspicion for the murder unjustly falls on Jim Marden. He gives himself up, and his brother, Wally, promises to run down the killer.
Ruth Burroughs the daughter of a beleaguered rancher whose valuable property is threatened by a greedy railroad company

Lt. Tom Brennan is cashiered from the 7th Cavalry on two charges, both unjust: that of deserting his men in the face of a cruel Indian attack, and of entertaining a married woman in his quarters after hours.

A cowboy arrives to help a girl who has a note due. He plans to sell her cattle to raise the money but they are stampeded and most are killed. Knowing who stampeded them gives him another plan to get the money.

Dennis Terhune, ranch foreman for John Morgan, an eastern capitalist, discovers that there is oil on Morgan's ranch shortly after Morgan has deeded the ranch to Daley, western manager for the Morgan properties.
A drifter befriends wounded outlaw Lafe Wells. Having promised to deliver a sack of gold to the man's family, Wales promptly falls for the daughter of the house.

Used-car salesman Ralph Slippery has found the perfect way to unload old worn-out automobiles; he places a cardboard model of a new, luxury car next to the junker, and the customer drives off in the jalopy. Ralph is long gone when the irate buyers return.

Van Bibber is spending his vacation with Colonel Paddock's party at the ranch owned by Paddock's friend. The peace and quiet is often disturbed by a desperado known as The Mad Racer, who has been hired to keep Van out of the Buggy Race.
Attracted to a girl, a cowboy takes a job on the adjoining ranch hoping to see her again and he gets his chance when her horse becomes a runaway.
A timid bank clerk has to toughen up during the search for a gang of bank robbers.
Lightnin' Bill Williams, the owner of a 50,000-acre ranch near the town of Cactusville, takes a fall off a cliff, and the experience affects him to the extent that he has lost his nerve.
A cowboy joins the Low Angeles mounted police unit.
Barely out of prison, Jim Regan is arrested once again, this time for the attempted shooting of Denver Dan Norris, the villain who framed him in the first place.
Horatio Winston, a senior at the college, becomes jealous of Ally's powerful physique and plans to make him the college boob.
"Jovial Joe" Ryan, a crack railroad engineer for 20 years, discovers during a card game with his pal, "Roadhouse" Rosen, that his eyes are failing him and he is becoming colorblind.
During the French And Indian war, a colonel fighting for the British (Tim McCoy) falls for the French commander's (Edward Connelly) daughter (Joan Crawford).
